description: I love this place. Only 15 minutes from my house and they have all kinds of good Mexican Food and the prices arent that bad. I love the different colored chips and the mixed cheese they use. If you live in the inner and outer Richmond this is the Mexican Resturant to go to.
author: Bobby J.

description:
I've been coming here for many many years. The big tostada used to be the best in town. 

Last Friday came here and it was a little chaotic but not really busy busy. We ordered what we always order 2 chicken Tostadas TOGO and Large Gauc with chips. At first they forgot to give me my order of large chips and gauc, then the guy didn't want to give me chips because they were low on chips. WTF? It's 8pm on a Friday night. Not my problem. 

The tostada tasted like old nasty fryer oil. Couldn't eat much and made me sick. I sent a message to the business but they never responded to me. So I'm writing this 1 Star review and they've lost my 10 years 2-3 times a month family business.
author: L D.

description:
Always a little hesitant when buying a burrito outside of the mission district And man have I finally learned my lesson. 

This burrito straight up sucked...... sorry hate to say it. 1/10

Lots of fatty chewy carne asada pieces.
And flavorless ingredients.

Might taste good if you're trashed.
author: Jose R.

description:
Really don't like writing negative reviews because it could have been an off day for the restaurant.. but seeing these other reviews confirmed my suspicions/beliefs. 

The food isn't great - it's actually really, really average. Ordered mahi tacos and they came like fish fajitas.. very odd for tacos. And the fish was in tiny bite sized pieces?!? :( The sauce was actually really good but the fish was obviously unseasoned when I bit into it..meh.

Won't be back - would rather get papalote or even Gordo's. :( :( :(
author: Alyssa H.

description: I loved them until I realized that my bill of TO-GO order of freakin ONE BURRITO got a 20% service charge today. Just want the other people to beware before they give extra tips on top of that. Dear Pancho's owner, it is not about money that really matters hear. I think I can tips you much more if I got really good food and service. It's about feeling of getting cheated. If you cannot afford the cost of your staffs or ingredients, or whatever, please increase the prices! Don't add 20% service charge and not even tell your customers! You guys can do better than that. A lot of people still like your food including me. Please don't kill yourself this way.
author: Mel L.

description:
The burritos here aren't going to change your life, but it's not a bad stop for a quick, hot bite.

I was really confused by their burritos menu, and even after looking at it again, I still cannot figure it out. The prices are misaligned with the meat options, so I was unable to figure out what prices correspond with which. Since there were 4 meats and 4 prices, I figured I could just match them that way, so I ordered the chicken burrito, since I thought that would be the cheapest. But they charged me a price one dollar more than the cheapest price. So either I didn't understand how the menu was aligned, or they charged me differently from the menu posted in the restaurant. Either way is bad. 

The burrito itself came out piping hot, but is pretty small, maybe 2-2.5 inches in diameter. It goes well with the salsas available in the restaurant, but it's not a huge meal by any means. The chicken was fairly flavorful, and did have a good grilled flavor. The burrito isn't overly dry or overly wet, so it does have that going for it; it just doesn't have anything outstanding.

Overall, it's one of the cheaper options in the neighborhood, and you can just stop in and grab a relatively quick hot meal. The burritos are a fair size for lunch, but they're probably not going to fill you up. It's nice to have this option in this location filled with much more expensive meals, but I probably wouldn't try this place if it was out of the way.
author: Eric Y.

description:
I'm surprise that this doesn't taste like authentic Mexican food since all of the workers are Hispanic. But I do like Americanized Mexican food as well. It was just a little disappointing when I was craving the authentic version, this place didn't pull through.

I ordered the taquitos meal. It came with 3 taquitos. I asked them to put no onions, but they said it was pre-made and all they have to do is take them out of the freezer and fry them. Red flag right there. When I took a bite into one, the chicken was SUPER dry and very bland. Thank goodness it came with rice and beans. I dipped the taquitos into my beans and rice before each bite. It made it less dry and more flavorful. 

I also ordered a bean and cheese burrito. It was tasty and delicious. The disappointing thing was that they overcharged me by $2.00. I showed them the price that's hanging above their heads and the lady says that they raised their prices. Super misleading. 

Also, when you leave the restaurant, you end up smelling like old oil and it will stick on to your clothes and your hair for the rest of the day.

I will not come here again. If I want to eat tasteless food, I'll do my own cooking!
author: Darlene M.

description: This is the most awful expression of Mexican food I have ever eaten...anywhere. The mexican woman at the front counter looked at me like I was crazy when I asked if they had lengua tacos (they don't). When I asked if four tacos was enough she didn't answer so I ordered four and the bill with tax and a 10% at the counter tip came out to $20.00. Yes that's right $20.00 for 4 tacos and water. The chicken and carne asada were both very dry and not flavorful at all. If you want good Mexican food I would not eat at Pancho's even if the tacos were half the price I paid. To sum it up...awful food and service.
author: David C.

description: Rude staff, gross food, overpriced as fuck. My partner and I went there on a whim because Native Burger doesn't have outdoor seating and we had a dog with us, in retrospect it would've been preferable to ditch the dog altogether to have eaten somewhere at least slightly less reprehensible and ill-equipped for human consumption.
author: Elijah B.

description:
This place is on par with mexican food in San Francisco. Nothing spectacular but not bad. I'd like it if it were a little less expensive, I don't think Mexican food should be fancy or expensive. In fact, thinking about it more I've had way better tacos for way less even here in San Francisco. I had two tacos Pastore and a drink. The pastor was wet and juicy but didn't really have a lot of flavor. They did however have a nice salsa bar which made the tacos tolerable. Also, the tortillas are hand pressed and fresh. Unfortunately the fresh tortillas didn't have much flavor either. 

It's not that it's bad, its just not that good. I wouldn't go back even if I was desperate, I'd find something else.
author: Ben M.

description:
The food lacked any sort of flavor and it was very bland. Also food was overpriced.
The cashier rushed us and kept interrupting us while she was ringing us up. 

Plus: plenty of seating both inside and out
author: Vince D.

description:
#1 Chicken  Combo is the bomb.
Excellent food. Not 5 minutes from home, I'm loving it.
author: David A. E.

description:
Okay, went back again today, and this place is still super solid. It meets exactly what I think 4-star should: not the best in the city, not particularly noteworthy, but a solid neighborhood spot that you absolutely don't mind stopping in ever.

Please see my other review first for content on what I like most (the Borracho Burrito) etc.; this is more of an addendum onto that.

This time I tried something new - the Atomico / Atomic burrito - and I'm happy to report that it was also super tasty. Carnitas I think is where it's at for this restaurant, and they doused the whole thing in a mild tomato sauce and delicious melted cheese. 

I also put my money where my mouth is, and I tried the tacos. Unfortunately I'm disappointed to report that these are too price for what they are. Check out the picture for the size...$4 each? No thanks. DEFINITELY getting a burrito and a side of these tortillas is a better way to go.

It also made me realize that their chicken, while flavorful, was a little on the burnt and dried side...less noticeable in the burritos because of all the YUMMY sauce.

What could be improved? The prices, also the salsas (I only like about half of them, and the other half aren't just meh but actually are bad in my opinion).

Will be back here next time the mood hits and I don't wanna go all the way to the mission.
author: Chris S.

description: This place is not good. There was literally nothing on my tacos and this is how they came . No salt or seasoning and the beans tasted burnt and like the bottom of the pot. Such a sad excuse for Mexican food
author: Victoria H.

description:
I love Poncho's. Every time I'm sick I make my boyfriend pick up their sopa de pollo. Huge chunks of chicken, rice, fresh corn on the cob piece, avocado, and fresh corn tortillas. 

Aside from the soup, the atomic is bomb (get it?).

Definitely our go-to spot, surprised it only has 3 stars because it's sooo good.
author: Keely G.

description: This is a nice Mexican joint. I've seen them make their own flower tortillas. They have a salsa bar. Prices are reasonable and the food is generally very good.
author: M D.

description: Food is ok, salsa wasn't all that at either. Not too pricey about average for a SF Mexican restaurant. Most likely won't come back.
author: Sean S.

description:
Have been a regular, since they opened and had been pleased with their food and service.  Always take out specifying to go (for them to charge me for the bag)& always leaving a tip of a dollar.
This time I asked for a bag, and the guy asks for 20 cents!  New cashier and not the regular guy I see!
Don't plan to go back for a while!  No more tipping!
author: Mel I.

description:
Food was quick, but my chicken was burnt. 

Ordered chicken nachos and it was a shame that pieces of charred chicken were scattered under a mountain of glorious cheese and guac. An unpleasant surprise it was to be crunching on bitter charred pieces hidden beneath beans and cheese. Aside from the black pieces, the chicken was super dry. I ended up picking apart my nachos to avoid the chicken all together. Such a shame as everything else was delicious. Chips were thin and fresh, guac was chunky, and the cheese was melty. Loved the salsa bar as well. 

Maybe I went on an off day, but I'll stick with the Mission to get my fill of Mexican.
author: Michelle C.

description: Fairly solid burrito and taco place. Their salsas are alright. Can't go wrong, but there's nothing specifically remarkable about this place that I would go out of my way to get to.
author: Kurt N.

description: I tried. I did. I work nearby and I tried many a time. Overpriced, not fresh, soggy.  I haven't ever gotten something here that made me happy with the choice. This is the only Mexican place in the area.  Can we get a competitor please?
author: Natasha B.

description: This is my go-to Mexican restaurant within walking distance of me. They consistently deliver great food with good quality ingredients. Check out the sopa de pollo, my favorite item on the menu
author: Drew K.

description: Meh. Got the veggie burrito and it was pretty bland. Nothing to write home about.
author: Ryan W.

description:
This is the best place to get a burrito in the Richmond...PERIOD!  
Tommys's is good good too.  But it's more upscale and sit down.  This is the best, the bomb...Period.  The music is always nice too.
author: Colzie T.

description:
Who is Pancho? Are all the Pancho's affiliated with each other? Maybe a bunch of Pancho's got together and decided to create a few kitschy Mexican restaurants. The decorations are a mix of random and odd with a touch of Mexican. Take, for example, the big giant fish and a tiki mask on the walls. There is a decent amount of seating behind the grill, and a couple of seats outside.
The food is not bad. The menu offers everything you're looking for from a Mexican counter (burritos, tacos, quesadillas, tortas) at reasonable prices. There is also a self-service salsa bar. I usually get the salsa verde.
My usual order is a Chicken Burrito, w/ rice, beans, cheese, salsa, sour cream & lettuce in flour tortilla, for about $7. It's pretty good, but I could do without the soggy lettuce. They do a good job wrapping the burritos and they work pretty quickly. 
Mr. Joy's usual order is the Steak Nachos for about $10, which seems a little pricey to me, but it includes the works - cheese, beans, guacamole, sour cream, salsa, olives. Also pretty good and filling, but personally, I'd prefer it without olives.
If you're in the mood for something Mexican in this neighborhood, Pancho's gets the job done.
author: Joy W.

description: Panchos deserves 5 stars!! The food is delicious and authentic without being heavy or greasy the salsa choices are great and the chicken has a homemade smokey taste you can clearly tell everything is fresh and they are super friendly also very honest. You should totally try them out.
author: Laicee B.

description:
I had heard quite a bit about this place and was actually looking forward to it...then came the fateful day that I actually ate there...

Food was so-so...actually closer to so-so bad :-(.  I ordered the grilled fish burrito and i couldn't even honestly say that there was even any fish in the burrito at all.  I looked once or twice but didn't see any, but I just kept eating since hunger dictated quantity over quality.  Overall the flavor was pretty bland and it wasn't remotely close to what I was anticipating.

We also ordered the Jalapeno poppers...no spice, out of the box type poppers...the ones at Costco from TGI Friday's brand are better...and that's not saying much.

At the end of the meal, I ended up walking out quite unsatisfied.  I don't think I ask too much of Mexican food, but even then, it under-delivered and with all the many food places right in that area, it's not likely i'll be back...

Happy Eating!
author: Bradley H.

description:
Ambiance: decent seating and clean interior.

Service: not overly friendly, but quick. Nice when you're getting a lunch to go.

Food: ordered the Borracho Burrito with chicken. Came with rice, beans, salsa, avocado. This thing was solid--so heavy and full of flavor! I had enough for two meals for sure. They also give you chips and have a variety of salsas to choose from. I would definitely come here again.
author: Susan G.

description: This is sad! Order a steak burrito  with extra sour cream and salsa to go and got some dry ass burrito with no sour cream in it !!!! Soo mad!!worst burrito ever!!! Never agian !!!
author: diana l.

description: Pancho's is my new favorite Mexican place in the whole Bay Area! The people who work there are so amazingly nice, especially Francisco!! The food is so so so fresh and tasty. I always get a veggie burrito there which hits the spot. I love this place. Will definitely be going back regularly! Thanks for the amazing food and hospitality Pancho's! Also, the chips are amazingly good!
author: Talia R.

description:
Went here earlier today and was extremely disappointed. Let's start from the beginning. I don't know what the cashier's issue was, but right from the start she had an attitude for no apparent reason. She seemed to be bothered by any questions asked. It wasn't enough to dissuade us from ordering but it was noticeable and added to the whole sub par experience.

Next up and most importantly, the food. I'm not sure how you can mess up something as simple as a burrito but Panchos has managed to do just that. 3 burritos were ordered and all had the same issues. All 3 were practically bean and rice burritos. The portions are large but for the price I'd expect more then about a table spoon worth of meat. We kept on eating the burrito hoping maybe a pocket of meat was hiding somewhere but no luck. Just a whole lot of beans, rice, salsa, oh and lettuce. Not sure what the deal was with the lettuce. It wasn't terrible but no where on the menu did it mention there would be lettuce in it. With that said, the beans and rice were extremely bland. No type of flavor at all. I've had canned beans that had more flavor then these. So it's a burrito filled with a whole lot of tasteless beans and rice and extremely little meat.

All in all the place was clean and the food was edible so I guess that warrants 2 stars but I would never come back nor recommend it to anyone I know. We ended up throwing out at least half because it just wasn't worth eating. I'm assuming there's not many taquerias in the area because there's no way a place with food as bland and overpriced as Panchos should still be in business.
author: Sophia B.

description: I stopped by at around 11:45 pm on Friday and the burrito I ordered was half cold and sort of disgusting. Totally regret my decision of giving this place a try. Thanks for the gross burrito.
author: Sa T.

description: This is an average Mexican restaurant off of Geary Blvd.  The service was good and food was okay with large burritos and fast service.  I would have given them 4 stars if the restaurant was cleaner.
author: Jack J.

description: Not only did they answer the phone in a rude way, but I waited 25 long minutes for two plain chicken soups with no flavor, no CHICKEN, got 4 pieces of dried stale tortillas for two soups, and charged a little more than the original price listed!!! First time and never setting foot again in this restaurant.
author: Leslie L.

description: I ordered three burritos one was supposed to have avocado, it had two pieces inside. The other two were supposed to have a green salsa, they both came dry. This place used to be really good, but the quality seems to be slipping.
author: Dylan R.

description:
Classic sf Mexican restaurant - mildly above average food, should be cheaper but it's not, quality is good but not great

The big positives are - awesome corn tortillas they make them fresh right there .... great parking and amazing salsas ! 

We stick with the basics - nachos and tacos. 

Finally. Nice easy parking makes for a big plus
author: Amit D.

description:
Finally decided to try it-  and as I waited for my two tacos and watched the cooks make other orders I already felt like walking out.

I ate two bites of the carne asada tacos I ordered- the meat looked dry and tasted dry.

The homemade corn tortilla was alright.

Will not return.
author: L. C.

description:
I'm a fan.

So many mexican/burritos stops in the Bay. This is one to try. If you can't make it out to the Mission, where there's an abundance on each corner. 

For my buddy, this is ol' stomping grounds. He's been doing this place for years, but alas, now no longer here, but visited today. When he picked this place, I said sure why not (it's his birthday after all). Plus, he was nursing a hangover, who am I to judge?

At these burrito spots, my beef is the carne asada burrito. I judge most joints by this meaty standard. I'll have to say, this one has some high quality carne asada.  Smoky, savory, flavorful. And there's a good ratio of meat to other ingredients. And as long as meat is greater than others, I'm all good. I will note, however, that the distribution of everything is less than ideal. One side had all the salsa, and for me, those were the final bites. Wish it more spread throughout. Also, I didn't notice any sour cream or guacamole... I bet that was my mistake. Great salsa bar tambien.

I'll come back again, if I'm in the neighborhood. Or if my hungover friend, from out of town, needs another old school cure.
author: Edward L.

description:
No. This is definitely NOT a place to go to for Mexican food. It looks somewhat authentic but don't let that trick you..

I ordered a burrito with no beans, rice, carne asada, salsa, cheese, and  avocados. Guess what I got in my lovely to-go burrito and already home comfy in my PJs. I got a soggy burrito with NO rice or avocados, straight up slimy beans with salsa and cheese. The taste of the burrito was disgusting. I will never eat here again and I hope others do so too. There's so many better Mexican spots than Panchos.
author: Jenn L.

description: I really dig this place. I've gone here multiple times, and it is a solid Mexican food joint. It is no frills, and is a great neighborhood place. I would recommend their fajita Burritos. I eat Burritos every where I go, and the best item on the menu at Panchos is fajita Burrito. I usually get grilled chicken. I love how chips come with every order, and they have tons of salsa available. All in all, solid!
author: Sean P.

description:
Pretty good Mexican food - especially for this part of town. Although Pancho's is not as authentic as your average Mission District taqueria, when you need a burrito fix, it does the trick.

I usually order the bean and cheese with everything option - as opposed to the veggie burrito which is full of sautéed bell peppers, broccoli and the like. It's a nice portable meal. 

And nothing warms up a dreary, fog enclosed night quite so much as the chicken soup with handmade tortillas. It's so comforting and fresh...mmm mmm good.

Nice salsa bar and, clean dining room and quick efficient service add to Pancho's appeal.
author: Carole B.

description: The steak and prawn burrito was not that great... couldn't find the prawns with everything else going on... the few I found were very small and of poor quality and appeared under cooked.  Wasn't put together well including big pieces of tomato not cut to standard size and large pieces of green bell pepper... not for me!
author: Kathy W.

description: I usually come here out of convenience.As a Mexican from LA, this food is barely even good by San Francisco standards. Everthing from their regular burritos to their breakfast burritos to their chicken soups to their chips and guacamole always has a sort of artificial sweetener taste (a tad bitter). Today, I came in for a breakfast burrito... 15 minute wait with no customers, $8.69, and a skinny burrito that I could have gotten from Taco Bell for a maybe half. Their fresh drinks are always good though. Everything else... no. Only come here if you don't want to go to Tacos El Gordo on 19th or Chipotle on Masonic (yeah Chipotle).
author: Nestor A.

description: I laugh at the reviews that this is not "authentic Mexican".  I've been going to this place for many years with my Family.   The food is great and the prices are reasonable for San Francisco.  Getting the Combos is such a good idea.  My 7 year old has been coming since she was a baby. She's now a familiar face and treated like a little star by the Kitchen Staff.  I will say the Nachos and Torta my least favorite item.
author: armando t.

description: Finally a legit Mexican restaurant I love in SF! I used to live in TX and talk about legit Mexican food. Been living in SF for a year and still looking for that Mexican restaurant I crave. Super quick and convenient. The tortilla chips are so legit and my pressed out corn tortilla was also legit. Maybe I should try their burrito next. SF loves their burritos...I'm more about the tacos and more so breakfast tacos! SF needs to learn the texmex ways! How I miss thee. Panchos filled my void :)! Panchos And West of Pecos has my ! Thanks Panchos for those bomb ass tortilla chips!
author: Lauren H.

description:
I WISH I WASN'T ABLE TO GIVE THIS PLACE ONE STAR:

My first time here was last week.....I walked into this place with high hopes

They had all the right touches: real Latinos making the food, décor, music, pictures, etc.

HOWEVER, they had some guy there taking pictures of them "working."

The one cook there was too interested in getting his pictures taken that we were waiting FOREVER for our food.

FINALLY, when he went to start cooking my food, he made two shrimp tacos and I don't think anything of it thinking it may have been for another customer....I ordered a shrimp burrito with pinto beans, salsa, rice and cheese. He precedes to hand me the box and I told him I didn't order that and then he goes, "what did you order?" I look at him dumbfounded! Like are you joking right now? I guess the lady who rang him up apparently didn't give him my order slip! So I have to repeat my order to him.

This is the best part:

He takes the two shrimp tacos he stupidly made, dumps them both into a flour tortilla and has me REPEAT my order....I emphasize on the word repeat because he STILL gets my order wrong!! Instead of pinto beans, he puts black beans! So I tell him AGAIN, I didn't order black beans, I ordered pinto beans; instead of making me a new burrito because at this point the one he's making is a complete CLUSTER, he grabs a spoon and pushes the beans off the tortilla and adds the pinto beans. I'm in complete shock! I've NEVER seen anything like this ANYWHERE and NEVER ONCE did this guy apologize to me. I would have said something but at this point, I'm way too tired from my day to complain right there. So after he puts my burrito in my bag and throws it on the counter, I leave pissed! 

I get home and start eating the thing which isn't too bad but of course I've had WAY better....I'm a few bites in and notice that I'm not chewing on just shrimp, I spit what I have in my mouth out and see that it's steak! WTF!?!?! This idiot put steak in my f*cking burrito!!!! Yes, I eat seafood but I DO NOT eat MEAT and here I am with steak in my burrito!!! I could not f*cking believe this sh*t....I really couldn't.

If I wanted a disaster burrito, I would have made it myself! 

By far one the worst takeout and customer service I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED!
author: This Is M E.

description: Got a carnitas burrito and it was pretty disappointing. Dry and flavorless carnitas, salsa taste almost like rotel, beans were bland, and it was kinda pricey at $9 before tip. Was not impressed at all at what they are cooking. Not very many Mexican burrito places on this part of town so may be worth it if you live around the block but I won't be back while in area.
author: Paul V.

description:
Update - A definite drop in quality of food in our last two visits. My burrito was bland and too salty at the same time ... tough to do that, right!?! Also, the tortilla chips were stale and the rice seemed like it had been reheated a few too many times. Come on Pancho's, get it back on track!

Old review - Consistently good food and friendly service. Their burritos and tacos are pretty much what you'd expect but the soup and torta are both standouts. U
author: Dave E.

description:
One of the gems on the menu is their homemade Sopa De Pollo... Especially in our foggy Inner Richmond neighborhood. Available in cup or bowl size... The bowl is big enough to share and a good take-out option.

If you dine in they make a nice range of salsas.
author: Brent O.

description: Not sure what I was thinking choosing a taqueria in the Inner Richmond when I know better, but I've passed this place so many times that I just had to try. Stale chips, salsa with no level of measurable heat, and a sad plate of nachos later (with barely any slab of refried beans), I regretted my decision whole-heartedly. The only thing I can say about this place that is slightly positive is that the cooks are quick. Otherwise, the food is really lackluster, and the prices are higher compared to the Mission. Go elsewhere. Gordo's (which is about 18 blocks down) is way better. But since you're already in the Richmond, just get Asian food instead.
author: Danny C.

description:
Personally I am not a fan of burritos so my review is biased towards these kind of spots. My friend who enjoys them is partial to this spot and goes to this spot on a weekly basis. The reason being that this place is a healthier option when compared to other similar places. My justification for eating this spot (take out) that it was right on the way when commuting to the place I was staying and right across from BevMo so while my order was being prepped I could just go across and grab a beer or two to go with the meal.
They do offer a choice in the type of bread one wants and can modify toppings to your liking. One can load up on the fresh made salsas and free bag of chips. 
This place can get quite busy during peak hours so do keep that in mind. 
2.5 stars all said and done.
author: Elvis A.

description: I use to go here all the time. Sadly on a recent visit not only did I find a hair in my nachos but I also found a random stick (picture added). The cashier was super friendly & in the past I always felt the food was pretty good. Not Pancho Villas good but good enough for the Richmond. However, after the findings of this last experience, I won't be back. So sad.
author: Renata P.

description:
Counter full of ingredients that have clearly been sitting out, I don't know, all day. Just thrown together on a tortilla, that has been sitting out, I don't know, all day. 

Go somewhere else. Like, I don't know, anywhere else.
author: Darrell L.

description: Disappointed with my experience. I've been here about 3 times since moving to SF 24 years ago, so obviously not a regular and seems like I won't become one. Came in and ordered a burrito. Asked for no rice, but to compensate the lack of rice with extra beans. Super simple request, I think? The lady behind the counter left for a moment to write something on the check. Got the burrito and noticed it wasn't as full as other joints make them. Ton of tortilla and not a lot of inside goodness. Turns out they took out the rice and didn't add extra beans - made for one flaccid burrito. The check simply said "no rice". For $10+, one would expect more. Lousy customer service. Tasted... "meh", plenty of other places to enjoy a well-made burrito around town.
author: Daniel P.

description: Chicken burrito was great (tender, fresh, big portions) and affordable. Ordered to go and it was ready when I walked in. Salsas were disappointing.
author: Shawna G.

description: This is my favorite burrito spot. Ive ordered the broacho burrito over a dozen times and it's always been amazing. I highly recommend this place.
author: Karine P.

description: I've been going to Panchos for years and its average. I've never been blown away by any of their dishes and sometimes they mess up your order. The meat in the tacos is usually dry but their burritos are okay. Usually a little plain and make you feel pretty bloated. I'll keep going here but I prefer Gordos
author: Carmel G.

description: Love walking over to Pancho's for a delicious plate of shrimp tacos!! My roommate and I love heading down to Geary for an awesome dinner here- and it's so convenient because it's only half a mile from the university!
author: Noreen C.

description:
After exploring a variety if Mexican taquerias in the mission district, I was directed to this delightful spot on Geary which has some lovely options.
The tortilla soup is absolutely delightful, it has a great blend of chicken, veggies & tortilla ratio. The broth has a wonderful flavor and it also comes with a side of warm made to order tortillas
Let's talk tortillas... Soooooo delicious. As states above they are made to order so they are warm and pretty much melt in your mouth. 
Now for my Favorite... They now serve Tacos Al Pastor. This has been my "mission" within the mission district with some lack luster results. It now Panchos is serving some Awesome tacos al pastor! They are Very Authentic and worth going if your a fan of al pastor :)
author: Rebecky L.

description: This is one of the best places out there in the city! I love their burrito! It tastes really good! Their tortilla chip snacks are great tasting as well! I'd definetely recommend this place anytime soon! I try out this place a lot so I bet you guys out tere should too!
author: Asher D.

description:
I called up to order for pick up and the bro on the other end kept correcting my non flavorful pronunciation of the words "carnitas" and "tostadas". I get that this is a humurous kind of curb yr enthusiasm moment, but now I have no mediocre mexican food and want to call back and order like 75 karniduhz for "pick up." I know thats a mean way to think. I need to go pray the hate away. 

In conclusion, i used to rep their karniduhz hard, but now I feel like a victim of pronunciation discrimination. Also its a lot of energy to promounce Spanish words like a Univision announcer. Panchos has to understand that the singularity is upon us, and soon all of this will be nothing more than an ancient meme.
author: Adam H.

description: Was missing the salsa I ordered and when I called restaurant they were no help at all, blamed it on the driver rather then making sure their customers orders are correct before handing them off. What are chips without salsa? Burrito was not the best either.
author: Alychiphey B.

description:
This place is okay. What do you expect for Jordan Park? Really the only thing I like here are the nachos....and they are good. Gordos does not do them.

I prefer gordo's burritos and tacos and plates better.
author: David G.

description: I've should of trusted the reviews. Oh well, it's a hit or miss and this is a big time miss! Terrible salsa and the worst burrito I've ever had. What a sad place.
author: tai t.

description: Fast service and great horchata!  Beats most other SF lunch spots that are over crowded and balls to the wall hipster vegos.
author: Sam W.

description:
Pancho's has the best salsa/burrito combination in the Richmond. I was quite impressed the first time that I came here. The portions are very generous. The staff and cooks are very friendly and prompt. 

First of all, Pancho's has several types of tortilla's to choose from at no extra charge. I had the chicken burrito on a whole wheat tortilla. 

Chips and salsa bar are complimentary. Chips are fresh and the salsa's are excellent. 

I found the meat and fixings to be very tasty and flavorful. 

I come here for lunch often. 

Yum,

Angela
author: Angela T.

description: I ordered the fish tacos and was really unimpressed, the fish smelled fishy even through the fried exterior (i didn't get sick but felt like I was taking a risk eating it!) and  said fried exterior was fried too dark, wasn't really crispy but more just tough and kinda chewy and had no flavor other than a little bitter from being burnt. Topped with red cabbage was its saving grace, cuz I'd eat red cabbage off of road kill...came with a plastic cup of reddish sauce that was kind of bitter, needed salt, and just...more flavor.  The chips were really greasy but would probably be good if fresh, the salsa bar was ok.... I'm gonna go back and try a burrito. Will report back! Service was nice!
author: Emma H.

description: I ordered a chicken burrito with black beans and guacamole.  I take it home and dig in and find there is no guacamole!  It is not just that I paid an extra $0.95 for guacamole,  but there was NO guacamole.  What a terrible disappointment.  When you're anticipating guacamole and there is no guacamole, it's pretty sad.  I live close by, but will never return.
author: Denise M.

description: Very good veggie burrito. The staff is friendly and the location is great.
author: John H.

description:
I used to go here fairly regularly. The people who work there are nice, and their food tastes good. The thing is, though, it's not a terribly clean environment, and I found hair in my nachos.

Hair = never going back again. Sorry.
author: Erik B.

description:
I don't know why all the bad reviews?

While my kid was recently at CPMC up the street... I wandered in here looking for a quick burrito... Gotta say this place was packed for a reason, line out the door! Steak & Shrimp burrito & a salsa bar... yes plz... Damn good! Ate here last 4 days straight... Had the crispy tacos too... Tasted fresh & crispy. 

Unfortunately my kids gotta serious heart condition, so were here at CPMC a lot.
author: Sleven M.

description: Four stars simply because they make corn tortillas fresh right in front of you. How many places do this? I love that detail. Also, as others have pointed out, the chicken soup hits the spot.
author: Noah D.

description: The location on Polk is noticeably better. This location doesn't look very clean inside, and though the menu appears to be very similar (if not identical), the same item prepared at this location was not nearly as good as at the Polk location.
author: Brett J.

description: Local burrito place with the BEST sopa de pollo soup!! My husband and I eat it all the time. Tastes like homecooking with love.
author: Gina R.

description: Pretty disappointing burrito for $10. I got a standard steak burrito and asked for guacamole. It was an additional $3( total rip off you could like get two awesome gordos burritos for around $13). Anyways, upon digging into he burrito there was maybe two slices of avocado.. No gauc. If she had told me that they didn't have guacamole, I wouldn't have bothered to pay $3 more bucks. The steak was weird and the rice tastes horrible.. Like instant mexican rice you buy from rice a roni. Anyways total let down as I had remembered from my childhood growing up in the richmond. Save your money and go the exta 20 blocks down Geary to Gordos. Won't be back again.
author: Katie S.

description: Burrito was very bland. This place is far from anything authentic tasting. Will not eat here again.
author: Nate T.

description:
Friendly workers, happy patrons, delicious food!!!
Try the soup on a cold SF day. You won't regret it. :)
author: Bree Z.

description: that was one of the most bland veggie burritos I've ever had... they grill the veggies fajita style which is usually better ...not this time
author: Loren B.

description:
We stopped by here tonight on the way back from a play and I am officially a fan!

Just for reference, I am a regular of Papas and Pollo in Sebastopol and particularly their delicious veggie burritos.

I ordered the veggie Atomic Burrito and for a mere $8.50 - about the same price as Papas' Tofu Temptation - I was treated to The. Biggest. Burrito I believe I have ever seen. I ate just under half and was stuffed.

The chips were crispy and fresh. The pico de gallo was delicious (out of the three salsas I sampled, it was my fave) and the place was clean and inviting.
author: Nora G.

description:
Tried it out just because I work across the street. 
Probably won't be coming back here again!
At first I asked for the combination #1 and asked to have 1 chicken taco and 1 fish taco! (Literally all the other places I've been to, I order that. Sometimes there's an extra fee for the fish, no problem.) But....she tells me "no you can't substitute, only 2 of the same thing in one order." Wth?!? I've never heard that before. 
So I have to rethink what I'm going to order and she starts talking to the lady in back of me...
So I finally order my option number 2. The Nachos with chicken and no sour cream. I get my order and there's barely any chicken on it. :( and their homemade chips where soggy! :(
Wow....
author: Ta S.

description: My torta sandwich was orale all the way. Packed with meat. My fellow paisano hooked it up!!
author: Daniel L. d.

description:
Who in the right mind charges $2.12 for a 17oz bottle of water......

Burrito was dry and no taste. Chips are good and the sauce section. 

Going to keep it Gordos.
author: Chuck S.

description: I don't frequent Mexican restaurants by any means, but I know I enjoy Mexican food in Mexico. When I eat Mexican food in the states, I always judge based on the quesadilla, salsa, pico de gallo and chips. All were very good to me. They definitely did not skimp on the steak. Their pico de gallo was sour enough for me so I didn't have to add lemon like other places (although tomatoes weren't as fresh). The chips were also crunchy and delicious. I would return again for sure.
author: N N.

description:
Nice people, and I thought the food was fresh until my husband and I got sick 2 times after eating there. We both had the carnitas burrito, one of our favorites. The tortilla was raw and cold, the extra ingredients were wilted and old, and the meat was seasoned with some nauseating spice. I was so sick to my stomach after eating this thing, we both were on one occasion, that I thought it was food poisoning. 

It took well over a month to be able to look at another burrito, something I typically crave once or twice a week. 

Wish we did not have to go elsewhere as it's nice having a family-run joint like this in the neighborhood but can't take the risk a third time around. Sorry but gonna stick with Gordo's for cheap, local Mexican.
author: Cara G.

description:
It's not the best burrito or nachos you'll ever have, but it's the only burrito place in my neighbor within walking distance that's open past 10. So 2 stars alone on that. 
Another star for ALWAYS being friendly when we come in. Even the cooks talk to us! 
And another for having beer choices when we decide to stay and eat there vs. take back. (The star is really for the mikes :p) 

Thanks Pancho's for helping me out with my late night cravings of a burrito!
author: Kristina S.

description: Typical burrito place
author: Long C.

description:
My roommate summarizes it best -- "you feel like you're eating food and you'll get full, but that's about it"

Pancho's is a perfectly mediocre neighborhood taqueria. I got the steak atomic burrito (the wet burrito) and it was just meh. I did the job at satisfying a burrito craving that didn't require driving somewhere, but there are far better places I'd go to (El Burrito Express, Papalote, El Metate, etc) if I wanted to drive. 

The red sauce on top of the atomic burrito was pretty flavorless and I echo other posters' comments about there being a big lack spice (atomicness?). The inside was just meh as well, everything just kind of blended together in a mediocre taste. 

Maybe some of their other stuff tastes better (like how bad could a quesadilla really be?), but I'm going to have to be pretty desperate to go back here for a burrito instead of just driving somewhere else.
author: Farhad M.

description:
Three great things:
1.  Well seasoned chicken.  (Too many taquerias have bland chicken.)
2.  Crispy Chips & Tasty Salsa! (Even the guac is fresh!)
3.  Big Portions at a fair price.

The only fault in my experience was that my food was served almost cold.  But I'm sure it was just a one-time thing.

I will return for sure!!!  :D
author: Victor C.

description: Panchos is the best little Mexican restaurant not in the Mission. The food is fresh and tastes great. I don't know why this place doesn't always get 5 stars. Every time I visit this place the food never lets me down. Out of the world nachos, tasty enchiladas, killer grilled chicken tacos, and  yummy steak burritos. You can't wrong with this place. The food here is better than Gordos, La Avienda, Burrito Express, Portola Super Market (inside Korean Taco Joint), and other Sunset/Richmond/Glen Park Mexican burrito joints. Also, the guacamole is super fresh and chunky delicious. The hot sauce is good but can't beat West Portal's El Toreador Mexican restaurant.  Still, Panchos is the winner hands down. 5 Bonus Stars!!!!
author: Frankie F.

description:
I went to this place once. I ordered a chicken burrito and it tasted like beige. The wrap was beige, the rice was beige, the chicken was beige, and in the right light the salsa could have been beige. It was the single-most flavorless burrito I've ever had. If that's indicative of the rest of the menu, then this place is not worth the money.

 If you're in the Inner Rich and you want Mexican, just suck it up and head down to Tommy's in the Outer.
author: Ashley C.

description: I live in the neighborhood & eat here regularly.  My favorite menu items are Al Pastor tacos, carnitas tacos, cheese quesadillas & carne asada nachos.  I usually do take-out, but it's a comfortable little establishment to eat-in, as well.
author: Sean P.

description: Ok Mexican. The woman taking the order was completely rude and had a bad attitude. Other people commented as well.
author: Sfgrl P.

description:
It pains me to give these guys two stars. These are please-get-it-together stars, not I-hope-you-fail stars. Pancho's feels like a charming f-up you keep trying to stay friends with despite repeated disappointments. I've never even written a bad review, and would never write one to vent after one less than stellar experience. 

Here's the deal: The food is fine, salsa is tasty (the hot one, yum!) but orders almost always --and that's literal, not hyperbolic-- get messed up between the counter and the making. I don't know why. It makes a great case for the build your own style burrito.

This was one of our work go-to lunch places, but frustration has severely limited the amount we order here. Today, I went to pick up two chicken burritos. In fact, they were a credit from an order where 5 out of 6 items were wrong.  Several people were bummed, and I called to tell them what had happened, and we were credited for the missing/wrong items.

Guess what? The order was wrong. The free burritos. The apology burritos.

Plus, their salsa bar is tasty, their tortilla soup is great, they all seem nice and mean well. I just really want that guacamole I try to have in my burrito to be there.

Can you fix this counter/maker communication problem so we can order burritos for lunch again sometime?
author: Paul R.

description: Whoa.  How is this place even in business?  The food is okaaaaaay (not good at all), pretty bland, but OMG the restroom?!?!?  It looks like something you'd see in a scary movie where you would get murdered.  The ceiling is all pipes and wood beams, it is a mess, and there is no sink!   If you want to wash your hands, you have to ask the guys that are making your food to step away from the sink so you can wash your hands in the same sink that they are doing dishes in.  Gross.  I'm all about supporting local businesses, but come on, that is just weird and nasty.
author: Daisy A.

description:
Been a customer for over 10 years and the burritos were never a favorite however they have many classic dishes I crave...
- Mahi Mahi Tacos w/ Guacamole Salsa
- Chicken Soup made w/ chunks of cob corn, fresh avocado, white meat chicken (this is a must when battling illness and my toddlers love it too)

Their prices are  generally steep and $.25 for a bag if you plan a pickup order.
author: T J.

description:
Started going here because it is the only Mexican restaurant I knew of in the Richmond District. The price is not that great because i'm a student, otherwise I would go more often. Now that I live closer i've upped the visits. 

The food itself is okay, not particularly memorable. The staff is very friendly and the service is generally quick. This place can fill up sometimes and others not so much. The food was not particularly memorable but I think it's because they're trying to stick to a uniform palette since they have another location now open. 

The crowd is mainly groups or I have seen some professionals from nearby offices grab lunch here sometimes. This place is family friendly so I would recommend it for that reason too. 

The main reason I rated it 4 stars is for their aim at authenticity, not with the food, but everything else. The decor is pretty cool, they've got old school Mexican advertisements and other authentic Mexican memorabilia, which I appreciated as a fellow Mexican.
author: Rose E.

description: I have eaten here and I am not satisfied with the quality of the food. Their tacos and burritos are tasteless. Do not deserve to carry the name of a Latino food restaurant. Latino food is delicious.
author: Allan S.

description:
We trekked across the city during rush hour to check this place out on the recommendation of a friend.  The basis of the excursion was that my Australian friends wanted the spiciest tacos that I could come up with, but as I don't know my way around the city too well, we leaned on my friend "the native's" rec.

Pancho's was quite good.  We had carne asada and carnitas tacos.  The carnitas was significantly better.  They put a spicy red sauce on them which, despite my request to make the tacos as hot as possible, was only sort of spicy (but did burn my lips well enough in all the little cuts). 

They also have something called The Atomic burrito, which you would anticipate being spicy, but sort of didn't sound like it was particularly hot...  We didn't try it.

At any rate, I recommend this place.  Nice people and good food.
author: Brian B.

description: The Borracho is by far my favorite burrito. I have never had a BBQ burrito before and it's soooooo good it makes you want to slap yo mama! I'm trying the Atomic today and I heard the Atomic sauce is incredible... I'm getting steak and bacon on my burrito and it'll be my first time trying that combo and it sounds super delicious.... Just make sure to ask for chips b/c they can be kind of skimp on them but other then that they're awesome! SF baby!
author: Tyler M.

description: They have raised prices YET AGAIN for marginal Mexican food that i saved only by their condiment bar. No no no anymore. Got to Super Burrito at Polk & Sutter for more authentic (and cheaper fare)
author: t l.

description:
I typically stop at Gordo's further out on Geary if I want Mexican for lunch, however this time there was a meter out front with time on it (!), so I stopped in. Friendly enough place and very clean.

Pretty much inedible burrito - I gave the lion's share of it to the birds out at Land's End. Some of them just shook their heads and flew off to more promising fare.
author: George S.

description: Their shrimp and steak burrito is a gift from God.
author: Nick F.

description:
You walk in and the walls and decorations are colorful, you can watch them make your food, but eh it's really nothing special. 

The burritos are around $7, depending on what you want on them. I got a carnitas burrito for about $7.60. The chips they include are thin and greasy, but not in the good way (I got it to-go, that may have affected them in the bag). But still. The carnitas were actually pretty tasty though, and tenderly pulled apart, which was nice.

Overall, I wasn't impressed by this place, maybe I have mexican food too often. But the burrito was pretty narrow, almost as narrow as my wrist. Their salsa bar has the essential basics, but nothing too memorable. 

I mean, I'd go to this place again, maybe, if it so happened to cross my path and I was really really really desperate for some mexican food. I just wouldn't go out of my way. Ya know? Okay, that's all I really have to say. Wait no, I have another thing to say: Chipotle.
author: Erika M.

description:
Good food at affordable prices.  Their dips and the head cook's sporadic bursts of Spanish opera needs some major adjustments.

I ordered the "Veggie burrito" with a small horchata.  The sum was $9.72.  Unlike most taquerias 'Veggie burritos' made with rice, beans, and salsa or 'Supper veggie' that includes guacamole and/or sour cream, Pancho's has their own version.  It includes mushrooms, broccoli, bell peppers, and squash.  Nice twist!  Size-wise, it was equal to a 'super' and was d-lish.  It keep me chomping until gone.  Their salsas and other sauces however, weren't to par.

At their salsa bar made readily accessible to patrons (as opposed to being stingily held hostage behind their counter) they had pints of pico-de-gallo, salsa verde, pickled veggies, and diced onions w/ cilantro to pick from.  The salsa verde as runny as water and the pico-de-gallo wasn't busting with freshness.  Also, they're kinda skimpy with the complimentary chips.  You're welcome to ask for more but I've been used to having a bowl-full elsewhere with all my orders. They're also not fresh; a bit over salted. 

The cook, a man who seems knowledgable about making quality foods, doesn't bare the same intellect when it comes to maintaining a merry dining environment.  He sporadicly signs along with a Hispanic/Spanish language radio playing throughout business hours.  The cook attempts to match the artist's grander by mimicking a Spanish Lucciano Pizzichini. Its kinda annoying as he's not good at it. 

As for cleanness, they seem to be on the ball.  During my 2 hour dine, the staff would swing by previously occupied tables and mop em' down with cleaners, NOT just water.  She'd also mop the floors every now and then too.  Clearly, there's enough regular foot-traffic to keep the place relatively sparkly.
author: Honest J.

description:
This is my go-to spot when I'm craving a burrito. I have a few favorites: steak borracho burrito, chicken fajita burrito, and the small chicken burrito when I need something on the smaller side. 

The soup is great too, very hearty! When I'm not in the mood for a burrito, but still want Pancho's, I'll go with the tostada. 

It gets quite busy (another sign of just how good they are), so I advise calling in your order.
author: Jason M.

description: My go to burrito place near work. The burritos are pretty good and large the Nachos are so so. The have good salsas and sauces as well. I give it 4 stars because it's reasonably priced and it's the only taqueria in the area.
author: Adrien K.

description: Good solid fare.  Has agua frescas (they had horchata, melon and I think strawberry today -- I had the melon).  There is a salsa bar. There's lots of seating and some nice decorations to keep the place interesting.
author: Dan C.

description:
I come here a few times a year since it's literally the only Mexican restaurant in walking distance to me (besides Taco Bell if you count that) and I really realy wish I could give them more than 3 stars. But I can't

The food is just so bland & basic. It's fresh. It's fine. But there's nothing special about it at all, and it's very expensive. I paid $20 for 2 burritos and 1 drink last time I went. 

They have a salsa bar, which is also extremely bland. They have those cool multi-color corn chips. Also the blandest chips you'll ever taste.
author: Venus S.

description:
I don't understand why there are so many negative reviews for this place!

I went to Pancho's about a week ago.

The pricing is VERY AFFORDABLE in my opinion.  I ate a steak and shrimp burrito for $7.85.  Well worth it, especially for over-priced San Francisco.  I think the most expensive item on the menu was 8 or 9 dollars. 

The burrito was really delicious, but a bit messy (probably because of the salsa that I added on the burrito). 

I will probably be back here again!
author: Alisha L.

description: Great food with lots of options. Tortilla soup was excellent and tasted so fresh. Recommend the watermelon juice as well!
author: William H.

description:
Meh, this place is alright. Tastes like any burrito that I've eaten before just a lot more pricey.

A cup of guacamole is like $5!

I'll think twice next time Panchos. :(
author: Mabel Y.

description:
I live near this place, so am tempted to eat here, but for 2.5 years I have had the same experience every time I go:

1. Very slow service that is minimally friendly. 
2. Mediocre food.
3. High prices for the portion sizes.
4. A disorganized line that misplaces orders, and easily becomes backed up.

I get that fresh food can take some time. But 30 minutes for one burrito to go when there were only 5 people in the place?

I have given Panchos several tries, over a relatively long time-frame, and tonight will be the last time I bother. 

I have worked in food service and restaurants for many years. I'm not sure how this place stays in business when they really don't seem to give a damn about their customers.

There is incredible Mexican food with love and care put into it, for less money, available all over this city. 

Hasta la vista Panchos.
author: Lola B.

description: Went here and ordered tacos plate, paid and waited for my food to be ready. I have never paid for a bag at a restaurant before. However, when my food was ready and I asked for a bag, the guy handed me a small paper bag (which would not fit my boxed tacos) he turned away from me and I had to wait for him to turn back around and ask him for a plastic bag that would actually fit my food just like the one he gave the 5 people before me. He then said 10cents. I thought are you kidding me!!!!!!! So I fish out 25cents and place it on the counter and he calls to the lady at the register to give me change. When I returned to work I found that he had charged me for not only the plastic bag but the paper bag that I didn't even use. And to put the topping on the cake the tacos were not anything to write home about. I will definitely not eat here again.
author: Zoe B.

description:
I had a hunger emergency. It was late and I was alone, tired, hungry, and cashless. A few burrito bites before bed was all I really needed. 

This place was my saving grace:
1. They were open that evening until midnight
2. They took cards
3. They sell small as well as regular sized burritos
4. My order came with free super tasty chips

I'm not used to going to places where cheese and sour cream come standard with all burritos but I know some people who love putting that stuff on everything, so they'd probably appreciate that. I don't mind my either way. It's a nice novelty.

I ate my small burrito, a few chips, and slept happily for a ton of hours. It was great.

I'd had tacos and a tostada here before and they were equally good at satisfying my hunger.
author: Loli L.

description:
I really like going to Pancho's because it's reasonably priced, accessible, and has consistently good food. The chips won't blow your mind, the salsa bar is fairly standard (maybe a bit on the boring side), but the quesadillas and burritos - the main event, if you ask me - are great.

Overall, it's a really comfortable place. There are always tables, often by the window, and the guys who work there are pretty friendly and helpful. The food is prepared quickly, carefully, and with fresh ingredients.
author: Jiordan C.

description: Their Barracho burritos are superb, one of my favorite foods to eat in the city for lunch. However, whoever is in charge of the music needs to understand that a tinny, abrasive, not-quite-tuned-in radio station of bad rock music is downright obnoxious and will drive the clientele away.
author: Len M.

description: Really poor service every time I eat here. The cashiers are always rude and seem to be ignoring the customer. Please wake up and RESPOND to the things that the customer is saying to YOU. Don't just stand there scratching the crabs out of your crotch. Open your mouth and use language to communicate with your customers.
author: Grey Z.

description: The chips are good but that's about it. The lady at the register is rude. She was too occupied in her mind in la la land. It was very awkward. I ordered a grilled chicken and steak taco. I can mKe better tacos at home.
author: David S.

description: Everything was excellent. Both burritos had very fresh ingredients, perfectly seasoned. Delicious. This was during a busy Sunday pm rush with 2 cooks rockin it! Will definitely be back.
author: Russell A.

description: Just experienced some of the best carnitas I've ever had. Perfectly seasoned and flavored, tender and fresh meat. I got the tacos which came in a corn tortilla that was incredibly fresh and delicious, normally I am not a big fan of corn tortillas but these were perfect. Their homemade chips, salsas, and aguas frescas are also all incredibly delicious and fresh.
author: Ryan M.

description: Tasty, consistent Mexican food with quality ingredients, big portions, and polite and hard-working staff.  All you want in a casual neighborhood restaurant.  Gordo's is far more greasy, and less interesting in terms of the blends and varieties of flavors.
author: Gregory C.

description:
The food here has a tap water taste and everything I seem to order is too wet-juicy. 

It's fast. Sometimes the staff at the register aren't too friendly. Meh.
author: danielle w.

description:
Pretty good nachos (which is all I tried).
But dudes... where is the spice in the beef?

Citrus, garlic, cumin, oregano...
Spice it up please!
author: Davo W.

description: Been wanting to try this place. I have to say I'm pretty disappointed with my nachos... And maybe I did not eat them hot. But it was  the most dissatisfying nachos I've had in my life. In general.. I'm a big fan of nachos, but this place got me thinking twice b4 I order nachos now
author: Monika T.

description: Seriously the crappyest buritto I have ever had. No flavor and weird texture. Would not recommend this to my enemy.
author: Mario A.

description:
horrible food and over priced.

The food is extremely dry and is basically one step over taco bell yet double the price.

Pretty much everything is spicy (i really can't handle spicy food)

The food is mostly rice.

The only good thing is that you have a choice of different tortillas; flour, wheat, chili, spinach
author: Cescilia A.

description:
I walked by here looking for a place to eat for lunch. I thought hey cool, Mexican food and there seemed to be quite a few people in there so it must be good, right?

Not the friendliest of people working there, but they aren't mean by any stretch. I got the Borracho burrito and wasn't all that amazed by it. The burrito is a pretty normal size, but I wasn't blown away like I had to come here again. Maybe it was just what I ordered, but it was a meh.

Having a salsa bar is a nice touch though.
author: Alex T.

description: I ordered a steak burrito. It was very dry and full of lettuce. The steak taste like hamburger meat. The burrito was so nasty I couldn't eat it. What a waste of money and time. The person who helped me nice. The restaurant was very clean.
author: Janine C.

description:
Apparently I haven't been as won over by Pancho's as some of these other reviews...maybe I'm just ordering all the wrong things?

I ordered their carne asada burrito and was just kinda "eh" on the whole thing.  It was filling, but what burrito wouldn't be?  I felt like the ingredients were just okay, and it wasn't as flavorful as I had hoped.  For the money that I'm paying on it, I would have preferred something that stood out from the pack a little more.

They do win out with their chips though.  Multicolored and flavorful, it's especially handy that they have a whole mini-bar of salsas and hot sauces.  Their nacho plate is quite hefty on the goods too, which lands them some points.  Overall, I'd say 3.5 stars, but I'd go higher if I find an entree that comes out above average.
author: Mike L.

description:
After 10pm - when you've been beaten to death by 12 straight grueling hours of the school-work-school death combo - the last thing you want to do is scour around for restaurants still open. Luckily Pancho's IS and a good place to settle for if you need a quick late dinner. 

I've only tried the fajita burritos: they're proportionately assembled, not a heapful of rice with a sliver of meat and a million beans like other places, it's just right. Great substitute if you prefer fajita plates without the gargantuan portions. Prices cater to a college student's budget. 

However, I question the handling of food: the cooks brazenly scoop tortilla chips in your paper bag with their BARE HANDS. o_O (like reallywtfdidthatjusthappen? More like manhandled the chips.. I was a little taken back..... needless to say I didn't eat them.
author: Annie L.

description:
I love Pancho's. I tried Burritos all over the city and none of them live up to the veggie Burrito in Pancho's.
The people are really nice and the salsa bar is good
author: Alex M.

description: Not really that good and the employees don't really care or not if you come in. I've come here a few times because it is the only option in the area but never again. I can wait next time for quality food and service. If this place was in Modesto it would deserve 5 stars but this is the city.
author: Justin S.

description: First time here, hungry and tired so I wanted to enjoy a good lunch unfortunately my burrito was cold and simple but I noticed some customers (white people) were treated really special. I don't understand why these employees don't treat people the same way. I'm not coming back. 2/15/16 at 2:15 pm
author: Luis F.

description:
This place is very close to my boyfriend's place which makes it very convenient for us to grab a quick bite from here.

We've tried this place a couple of times and it never isn't as good as the other mexican places in the area.  Everything tastes so watered down and not fresh.

Plain and simple ... go somewhere else.  Maybe I haven't tried the right thing from this place, but usually everything I order from any other mexican restaurant is good no matter what.  So this place just didn't do it for me.
author: Pia V.

description: I was starving when I came into Panchos.  I ordered the tostada since it cost more than the burrito thinking it would be bigger.  It turned out to be tiny.  Meager.  I looked over at someone else eating a pretty decent size burrito and pretty much cringed.  Salty, small, expensive.  I would not go back.
author: Johnny B.

description: The service is great here and there's never a line. I have also never had an issue looking for parking on Geary. I would say it's more expensive than it should be for a basic burrito, but when I go I usually am full 3-4 hours after. The burrito definitely packs punch! The quality of the burritos are good, but I would say it's nothing special. However, I think it's better than Gordos.
author: Sharon M.

description:
I am a major wginormous (I love Pancho's so much I invented a new word) Pancho's fan!  Pancho's has been a favorite destination of mine for years. I always have the same order (because it's just that good).  I would eat at Pancho's everyday for dinner, if allowed. 

Because of my obsession with Pancho's, the girlfriend refuses to come with, BUT luckily for me I have a weird friend.  One day, I decided to invite him to Pancho's with me for a burrito. This changed his life radically! Ever since then, when I need a buddy to come with, I call him up. This guy is willing to drive half-way across the city to indulge in the wonderful food Pancho cooks up. And yes, in the rare occasions that he is unavailable, and I'm craving some Pancho's, I will go alone.

My order and my strong recommendation for anyone to try is this. Just walk in a read this exact line to the server: "Hi, I would like the Combination number 2, flour tortilla, please."  That's all you need to say and you will receive the absolute best Mexican food. The combo #2 we just ordered is a regular burrito + chicken quesadilla. The plate arrives with chips and guacamole as well. As a beverage, I would recommend Corona as everyone knows Corona is best paired with burritos and quesadillas. 

Now, I must admit that I have never (in all the years) ordered anything aside from the Combo #1 or #2. It's because this is truly the perfect combo.  While I'm sure the other products are great, I've never tried them. 

There is a difference is quality depending who the burrito maker is.  Sometimes the burrito arrives wrapped in foil, sometimes not.  Some burrito makers wrap better than others. If you show up for late night dinner, you will probably have a better burrito simply because Pancho will be less occupied with other orders.  

If you prefer, the order can be varied slightly to the Combo #1, where the chicken is placed in the burrito rather than the quesadilla.  Also, I've heard that other Pancho's locations are not as awesome. Never tried them. But if you have or haven't, give this location a shot. You will not be disappointed. It's easy to find street parking during the late night hours.
author: Nathan E.

description: Went today wanting the fajita burrito with shrimp, but ended up with not even one their regular burritos. It was an over grilled chicken burrito with too much rice, a few pieces of lettace and avocado, and maybe some cheese, but I really could not tell. I would have brought it back but I live about 2 miles away, and didn't realize until I got home and bit into it. I got some lame burrito that I paid WAY more for. I go here all the time and was really disappointed. I think maybe the new cooks, need a new job.
author: Nicole R.

description: Came in late night. Had the tastiest grilled chicken fajita burrito in my 27 year existence on this planet. Well done.
author: Brandon B.

description:
One equals two.

Pancho's math. What happens when you are given a grilled chicken torta filled with black beans, lettuce and tomato that is so good it's eaten over two meals.

Homemade BBQ sauce didn't last as long.

Your high school math teacher might not like it. But your stomach will.
author: Jason B.

description: If you like bland American Mexican this place is decent. They say their chips are freshly made, they definitely don't look or  taste that way. Will not be going back.
author: Kathryn R.

description:
Would have got 4 stars but for the fact I just walked in & stood at the counter for over a minute then to be told "sorry we are not open"
Lights on, tables outside, front door wide open as normal, its 9:36 AM.
If you are not open, then close the front door & lock it until you are ready to open & dont leave a customer standing there...
author: Jack H.

description: It's not the best burrito in the City, by far.  But I have grown to appreciate the #1 combo (two tacos, rice, beans, lettucey thing).  Order one chicken, one beef, slather them in lime, cilantro and onions, and you could do worse.  The place is very clean and the food is consistently decent.
author: John H.

description: You know, Pancho's makes a good burrito. They draw a line out the door which was my first initiative of going here. Fresh ingredients and nearby is all I need.
author: Patrick W.

description: The nachos are super dank! Burritos not so much. They are soggy, not cheesy, not too much flavor.
author: Arielle C.

description: I've been here a few times and tried the regular burrito with several different meats (chicken, steak, carnitas).  Unfortunately, each time I find I'm disappointed.  It's pretty bland, and I'm someone who doesn't like spicy.  Two stars because the chips and fruit juices are good.  It's always crowded at lunch, so what am I missing?
author: Melissa K.

description:
I ordered a steak burrito from this Geary location.  The burrito's tortilla wrapper was soft and fluffy.  The rice was well seasoned, the burrito also contained re-fried beans, boiled "steak", tomato salsa, diced lettuce, and sour cream.  The steak filling was a bit bland.  The burrito was ok in flavor, but fairly ample in size.

They had 4 kinds of salsa, old mild, two medium, and one spicy.  Chips come free with your burrito order.  Seating is limited but usually ample.

The burrito was acceptable and I would come back if I had an urgent craving, but will likely go somewhere else for my burrito and taco cravings.
author: Ed K.

description: Honestly the worst taqueria! I knew I should have not eaten the chicken burrito I saw them making. I was hungry and I was in a hurry. The meat just looked wrong. I'm so sick now. Don't eat here guys, I'm serious
author: steve a.

description:
Conveniently located on Geary, Pancho is the place to go for a late brunch or a late dinner on a lazy day. 

Price is reasonable, place is okay clean, unlimited pico de gallo and other spicy/mild sauces. 

I got the borracho con pollo. It was a very big burrito, I couldn't finish even half of it. Chicken is nicely grilled and flavorful. My boyfriend always gets the steak and shrimp burrito, he really likes that. Complimentary chips come with every order.

Good for family, friends, I wouldn't bring a date here though, it's not that romantic ;)
author: Erica L.

description: Pancho's inexpensive chicken burrito is what I usually get here. Good innards with fresh ingredients. It's the only decent Mexican food near CPMC California campus. Woooot.
author: Derek N.

description:
CHEAP, TASTY, AND THEY MAKE MINI-BURRITOS!

I love burritos and I love all kinds- call me an equal opportunist when it comes to burritos.  My only rule is that they be well-priced and tasty.

What makes this place so special though?  You can actually get a small burrito if you're just feeling peckish AND they offer a very tasty chicken and rice burrito option.  Mmm... their chips are warm and it's the best place to get a burrito in the area.

Stick to the chicken!
author: Christine K.

description: Got the pork tacos and they were terrible! It tasted like old meat that had not been refrigerated. I brought the food back and told them this, they assured me they make the food fresh everyday and that I might just not like the taste. Fair enough. They offered to make me a different kind of taco, I chose chicken and it was far better but by no means delicious. Also they charge $7 plus for their tacos (comes with 2) and the only thing that comes on the tacos is cheese. I gave them 3 stars instead of two because the people were nice and not defensive when I came to them with my issues. Wish I could give them a higher rating but it just wouldn't be honest. Proceed with caution and don't order the pork.
author: Genevieve N.

description: This place is pretty mediocre. I only go since it is so close to my place. I found a pretty good item to get though as the burritos aren't that great. Try the beans, rice and cheese side for $3. It's a good size portion. Then get some chips to make your own nachos. That's the only thing I get there anymore haha. It's usually not too crowded but be prepared to wait on father weekends especially during dinner time.
author: Ron D.

description: best chicken tacos ever! I love their guacamole, and the space is nice too. Plenty of space to eat in or take out. They are friendly and fast! I miss living above this place!
author: Stacey S.

description: Love this place and go a few times a week. Fresh, delicious food.  I've been going for years and staff is very friendly.  The guacamole is really good and you can buy it by the pint.  Great refried beans too.
author: Cynthia R.

description: I work nearby at Kaiser SF.  Another doc took me here, and told me "this is the best burrito in the city".  With the mission nearby, I was sceptical; but he may be right.  The borracho was one of the best burritos I have ever had; and I have had my fair share.  Other reviews complain about the price, but I found it very reasonable and comparable to other stores.  It was so good, I went back the next day.  Great salsa bar and friendly staff, with a clean shop.  Enjoy this place!
author: Zack G.

description:
Stale chips

Rotten tomatoes

Burrito taste like Body odor

Other than that you get what you pay for
author: Bobby B.

description: I ate here on Saturday and the tacos were no bueno unfortunately I did not like the tacos at all I haven't tried the other foods but from the taste of the taco I don't think I want to eat the others sorry guys.. It took long to get the two tacos as well
author: Farrah F.

description:
Yeah, yeah...Pancho's is about as authentic as George W. talking about his passion for the environment. But who cares? It's the freshest tasting California-style Mexican fast food I've had in the city. Baja Fresh should be so worthy of the title.

Located opposite the big Pier One Imports store on Geary, it attracts a busy lunch crowd even on the weekend. I can see why. My friend and I had a great experience when we tried this place once, so we decided to go for it again since we were in the neighborhood. Well, actually we weren't...we just got tired of Lucky Penny. The menu is pretty robust, but our eyes were focused on the combination plates, both at $6.95. I had the #1 - two grilled steak tacos on homemade corn tortillas with fresh guacamole and a side of refried beans and a small salad.

I have to say the tortillas were small compared to other places (I'm thinking of the superb El Zocalo in the Mission), but they just came out of the oven, I think, and they were soft and delish. The ingredients were incredibly fresh. My friend had the even heartier combo #2, which is a combination of a chicken quesadilla, a rice and bean burrito with homemade chips and guacamole and a salad. What a deal! Of course, they have the salsa bar with the sneeze guard. Very fresh, especially the mild red one which my friend used by the shovelful on his plate.

The decor is pure Tex-Mex cheese with a touch of Wal-Mart, especially with the autographed Julio Iglesias photo next to the serapes on the wall. But who cares? The service is pretty quick, and you will feel sated in a good way here.

FOOD - 4 stars...Ay! Yi! Yi! Yi! Muy bueno, senors y senoritas! 
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...to all the girls I loved before
SERVICE - 4 stars...muy rapidamente
OVERALL - 4 stars...is that a burrito in my pocket, or am I just glad to see you?
author: Ed U.

description:
Rating: 3.5 Stars

The BF and i finally decided to stop by and try Pancho's while driving down on Geary St on our way to downtown. First impression i had when i stepped into Panchos was the cleanness, open kitchen, lots of seating, salsa bar & wide variety of choices on the menu. I finally decided on the Fajita Chicken Burrito (i love grill onions and peppers!) and the BF ordered the Chicken Burracho Burrito. The manager was pretty nice and friendly. He was also helpful because we were literally standing in front of the menu for the longest time trying to decide what to order. 

Our meal was tasty -- nothing special but still very good. Our burritos was packed with lots of pinto beans, meat, and cheese even without the rice. I would definitely try Pancho's again and i would like to try their soup because it seems like EVERYONE was ordering it. 

Mental note: ORDER THE SOUP NEXT TIME! :)

Ps. Beware of their SPICY CHILI red sauce from the salsa bar. its really SPICY!!!!!!!!
author: Carol Y.

description: My kids favorite burritos! Fresh chips and salsa. quick easy place to go. They make fresh corn tortillas.  Tasty grilled chicken.  awesome thin chips, variety of salsas; very good chicken tortilla soup.  Reasonably priced.  Place is clean and works for families.
author: Ketan D.

description: Chips are thin but salsas are good. Burrito was big and affordable. I like how they are accommodating, as well.
author: Alanna R.

description:
The only thing I've ever tried here was a) chicken nachos and b) taquitos. 

The taquitos get 2 stars. The nachos, however, get 5 stars. They. Are. So. Freaking. DELICIOUS!!!

I lived RIGHT next door to Pancho's for 9 months. I got nachos here more often than anyone who doesn't want to be called a fat kid would admit. Their chicken is flavorful, the chips are salty & crisp, the mix of cheddar & jack cheeses is perfect. I also got mine with sour cream, guacamole (yummy guacamole too), and black olives. They give you salsa/peppers/onions if you want them, too.

I'm pretty much trying not to drool while writing this, that's how good they are. I haven't had their nachos in about 4-5 months, and I need a fix! Panchos! Please deliver to me in Redding, California, kthxbi!
author: Tiffany R.
