description: Fairly average taqueria fare. Flavor-wise a step up from Chipotle, which I find rather bland and uninspiring. Their hottest salsa was pretty hot but not that hot, though it had great flavor. I had a Carne Asada burrito with everything. It was about average size and filling.
author: Peter C.

description: Went here for a very late lunch. Didn't know what to order so asked the cashier to recommend his favorites. The atomic burrito was delicious and HUGE! My husband enjoyed his tostada, and our daughter found her burrito just okay. Their salsa bar was good, especially the rough-chopped fresh salsa. Their hot could've been hotter, though!
author: Mary C.

description:
The food here is okay...  I'm not a fan of their salsas/sauces.  
I've tried two of their burritos, while there was nothing wrong with the quality or quantity...I did not like the flavors.   

Service is fast though.  Quickly in and out.
author: Fannie S.

description: I had a guacamole craving and going to Panchos ruined it. The large guacamole was $3 but it came in a small container. I asked them if that was right and they said yes. I basically paid for a container in which you would put some dipping sauce in. It was gloppy and bland. There were no signs of fresh tomatoes or onions. Just green slop. My bean and cheese burrito was overfilled with sour cream. Never again.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: They gave tooo little chips with the burrito than any other taquerias i've been to. Burrito was average, nothing special. 2 stars because theyre too stingy with the chips!
author: Kim L.

description:
As a USF student, it's nice to have some nearby, quick and delicious places to eat (especially ones that aren't Mel's), so discovering Pancho's really made my summer. 

Can't complain about the price, service, or atmosphere, or the unlimited salsa bar (the verde is amazing).

Every time I go here I debate between three delicious choices:

-the Chicken Nachos, which are simple but delicious nonetheless 

-the carnitas Atomic Burrito, which you would expect to be spicy but isn't at all... just deliciousness wrapped in a burrito and topped with red sauce

and finally...

-the Sopa de Pollo, which is probably the most perfect chicken soup ever to grace the planet, with whole chunks of potatoes, corn on the cob, and avocado mixing perfectly with the chicken, rice, and other vegetables.

All in all, Pancho's is my go-to quick meal near campus. No offense, Papolote-- you're good, but Pancho's is better.
author: Tommy C.

description:
I had been going to Balazo on Haight St. for years and was totally bummed when they unexpectedly closed.    I'm scared to try Balazo's replacement El Faro after reading the horrible reviews.  I decided to try Pancho's.

The people there were extremely friendly and polite (unusual for this area and city...and I can say that!  I'm a native!)

I got the carnitas burrito.  The ingredients were fresh and the vegetables/salsa actually had a bit of a crunch to it.   The taste was good. Unfortunately, the amount of meat was disappointing, although it is about a dollar cheaper than most other burrito places.

I would actually give them 3 1/2 stars but since they were polite, I rounded up!
author: Jack L.

description:
We have eaten here now about 5-6 times in 4 months and have to say we are fans.

I don't eat pork (except bacon which doesn't count right?) so cannot speak to other reviewers comments on the carnitas.

The salsas are house made - fresh and the hot sauce is H-O-T!! 

The quesadillas are buttery and cheesy - the guacamole is all avocado - no fillers which is rare at a taqueria - the chicken tacos with pollo asado are fresh and tasty - have had the black and refried beans and both are house made and delicous.
author: Mylea C.

description:
This place is not very good. I also find it quite overpriced. My quesadilla was mediocre, and I could not believe how small the side of guacamole is... for $4! It's about half the size of Chipotle's serving, and half as fresh.

Seriously, there are so many great Mexican places in San Francisco. If you want a good Taqueria style place, go check out Papalote or something like that. Skip Pancho's.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Awesome! Best Mexi-fast food I've found this side of the city. Why didn't I try it sooner besides listening to all the OK reviews on Yelp? I should know better. Sorry, but a lot of the Mexican food reviews for SF are just, lets say, unreliable. I know good Mexican food. This place makes its own tortillas. Big plus. Has a kickin' salsa bar,with 3 temperatures of salsa, cilantro and chopped onions, and chopped jalapenos, of course. All of these are clues people, and the clues mean they know what they're doing.

I've only eaten here once, but that will change. I had the chicken taco combo. All fresh ingredients-corn tortilla, grilled chicken, refried beans, rice, and, their own home-made tortilla chips. How sad that the latter is so rare. Espero verte pronto!
author: Rich M.

description: The service is pretty good and the food's affordable. I like it's Mexican theme and they really try to create a nice atmposphere. It helps that they have a salsa bar too
author: Jacob M.

description:
The quesadillas are great.
Burritos are good, but I always forget to say "hold the lettuce" because  I shouldn't have to (lettuce on a burrito is weird.)

The service is quick, the seating is comfortable, and they're open late.
author: Ken B.

description: Omigod...these folks make the very best "sopa de pollo" (chicken soup).  It is so low calorie the way they make it...it can cure any cold!!!  White meat chicken and broth, rice, carrots, corn on the cob, cilantro, etc. etc. topped with avocado.  It comes with a homemade corn tortilla, and it is simply fabulous!  I manage to slip in there on my way home (decent parking but xlnt w Smart car)...I eat up my bowl of soup and surprise 'the husband' with a big veggie burrito for dinner.  The burritos are also outstanding...I love how each burrito place is "oh, so different..."  Sometimes I want Gordo's, sometimes El Burrito Express, sometimes El Toro, and sometimes Pancho's Salsa Bar...always meeting my cravings!  BTW their agua frescas are delish, but I try to limit them as I am sugar conscious.  Their chips and generous salsa bar are amazing, too!  Hasta mañana amigos!  Me gusta su comida!  Muchas gracias!
author: L H.

description:
Everyone has a ritual and Pancho's was ours. At least one or two nights a week after my shifts I used to treat these guys to some sweet pastries while we enjoyed some grub ourselves. 

Yesterday with fond memories we returned for a taste of nostalgia :) 
For me this is Beef Tacos on corn tortillas. 
I used to love the "Boracho" and the big guy loves the fajita burrito with all the fixings, these are large and filling but priced low, so YaY for cheap and yummy!

Always prepared quickly with attention to detail they lovingly make each order. This is a busy shop so it's always fresh. There are plenty of seats, both indoors and out on Geary. 


We still love you Pancho's !
author: Roanna Z.

description:
3rd and last time I've eaten here, the burritos are sh1t. I thought Gordo's were bad, but Pancho's is much much worse.

I had a simple grilled chicken burrito, light rice and light black beans, salsa, and cheese.

Bland and boring is too polite a description.

The 7 small pieces of chicken were drier than my grandmother's vag, the lump of cheese and tablespoon of pico de gallo were hiding in a pocket at the other end of the burrito, and they didn't go light on the rice, because otherwise there would have been nothing to put in the tortilla. So the burrito tasted mainly of rice, and I've had more flavorful rice in a Chinese restaurant.

Plus there was lettuce in it, which I didn't ask for, probably to fill it out a bit more.

Blecchhh!
author: Rob C.

description: Pancho's is disgusting!!!!! I think they include the scum on the bottom on of your shoe in their food! The fish tacos are $8 and consist of cabbage, corn tortilla, and sliver of week old frozen fish. The burritos are bland and the meat tastes old. The kitchen looks dirty and they proudly display their 85% scored card from the heath dept. by the register. Eat there at your own risk.
author: Al O.

description: Came here to grab a quick bite to eat on Halloween. I LOVE how their have a salsa bar because their chips are ridiculously good and I didnt have to feel bad about asking for extra salsa! Food is good, cheap and service is excellent!
author: M W.

description:
By far my worst experience in a Mexican restaurant. And let me list off the reasons why.

1. The place was absolutely packed full of little kids and their parents.  Like a full on mommy and me meet up going on there.  Not a fault of the restaurant and doesn't contribute to the negative ranking but still a bad start.

2. We order our food and drinks (horchata and a glass of water) and after paying for it I kind of stand there waiting for him to give us our drinks and the waiter stares back at me like what do you want.  My gf asks him for our drinks and he pours the horchata for her and then walks away.  We decide not to make a big deal of it and just split the horchata so we go get a table. 

3. I take a sip of the horchata and it has chunks of what I'm hoping is brown sugar in it but anything milk based should not be chunky and we go to take it back. Now I normally have a policy against returning anything at a restaurant but I thought they should be aware of what we just experienced so it doesn't happen to anyone else. We let them know about the chunks and one of the guys pours some more horchata in a cup tries it and says its fine.  We throw ours out and ask if we can just have some waters.

4. We are given one cup of water for the two of us but whatever, we go back to our table I take a sip of water and realize its carbonated water which I hate but at this point I'm already over it and discussing how ready I am to give this place a one star review on yelp as soon as I get home and the only positive thing during our trip happens.

*Another kid working there realizes we were given carbonated water asks if we would rather have regular water and if we would each prefer our own cups.  He also apologizes for the horchata.  As much as I want to give this place 1 star I do very much appreciate this gesture and they get an extra star for it.

5. When we get our food I dig into my carnitas tacos and I actually have the opposite complaint I normally do.  Meat being the most expensive item is usually what is lacking at most shitty Mexican spots.  This taco is all meat and the other ingredients are almost non-existent.  I mean I'm like me some carnitas but the only other thing on it was a tiny amount of cheese I couldn't even taste.

In other news their hot salsa is very spicy which I appreciate but had no flavor although their medium salsa was very good and my gf liked her burrito.

TL;DR: Maybe you will have a better experience than me but I will never come back here again even though its the only Mexican food in easy walking distance from my place.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Stepped in tonight for another fully satisfying experience.  This time I was wolfing down Pancho's Nachos with added steamed veggies.  The only complaint I have is that I ran out of cheese before I ran out of chips n topping goodies.
The salsa bar has a little something for everyone.  I'm a fan of mixing the pico de gallo with a healthy scoop of the reddish-colored salsa labeled medium.  I also dipped into the date's hot reddish-colored stuff: smokey flavor, and a little goes a really farkin' long way.
Extra bonus points for NOT PLAYING CHRISTMAS MUSIC!  That stuff can make me go from zero to stabby-miles-per-hour in about 10 seconds flat. 
Only wish the windows weren't so drafty; makes for a slightly chilled dine-in experience.
author: Rachel S.

description:
We had a group dinner tonight and we ordered 25 burritos to pick up. Delicious!

I managed to grab a chicken burrito with the usual rice, bean, salsa, sour cream and guac-- all wrapped up in foil, mission style! It's pretty fantastic. The chicken was grilled and has that nice subtle charcoal taste. I also like the ingredients ratio. A lot of other burrito places put too much rice or too much meat, but Pancho's got it spot on.
author: Teresa G.

description: Not sure why this place doesn't have four stars. The food is good, not amazing, but it gets the job done. Freshly made tortillas that are very soft and fresh, the chips and salsa are good and the prices aren't too crazy. This place doesn't pretend to be some gentrified fine dining Mexican restaurant and that's why I like it. When I need a decent Mexican meal for cheap without having to sit down and be served on and paying a tip, this place hits the spot. Also the jalepeños are great.
author: Reed P.

description: Awful.  So much great Mexican food in SF.  Don't waste your time here.  Truely disgusting.  The staff are so gross how little they care about the customer.
author: Gary S.

description: i would never ever come back again .. the worst burrito i've eaten in my life...it has no taste or flavor at all...plus it's dry...so i decided to salsa bar to get my salsa for my chips and i saw ppl double dipping their chips in the salad bar while waiting for their order...i quickly threw away my chips and walk out the door....this place SUCKS PERIOD !!! i do not recommend ppl coming here for food
author: Will D.

description:
The co workers and I decided on this place cos one decided to drive his Mustang convertable, top down and with girls at the back of his car :)

This place is an americanized taqueria. Line was pretty long as it was lunch time and somewhat the only taqueria in our area. 

We ordered a baby burrito and fajitas. The baby burito was good! But the fajitas, was put together than us having to put the stuff together on the tortillas making them look like tacos. Their chips I can say are fabulous as they are fresh, light and thin!

Its an ok place...cant beat the Mission taqueria...will come back if we REALLY crave for mexican and dont feel like driving to the Mission...
author: Elly G.

description: Ordered the "Atomic Burrito" and was completely bummed out when I cut into it and found what seemed to be an entire bowl of rice, like ten pieces of meat and a couple of beans.  I still don't understand why it is that a majority of taquerias in the bay area insist in filling burritos with rice!  Beans and meat, people... Beans. And. Meat.
author: Michael M.

description: Really tasty chicken and carnitas burritos,  I like the salsa bar, and horchata.
author: J R.

description:
First off let me get a few things out of the way.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE PANCHOS. THIS PLACE. I LOVE IT. As far as I go this is the best burrito I have found in SF thus far. People may say Gordos, but nah. This place is much better. Ill tell  you why.

they havea bunch of stuff. Not a limited menu. They got CHILE tortillas!!! CHILE! so good and spicy!

They are super friendly. Super. Mainly the same guys every time you go in, but I like that. I like to know WHO is making my food. Especially when they make it in front of me and MOST ingredients and be premade and all in all not good. Not here.

Every so often you hear a MASSIVE chopping of chicken with butcher knives. Watch amazing hot chicken go into my burrito.

All in all I probably go here once a week if not more, and ALWAYS bring my fellow mexi food lovers who come to visit here. Throw in beer and you are SET!

MY FEW GRIPES. That in no way are meant to deter you. GO HERE, you will like it! Tip them as well. They work hard and deserve it.

The Salsa. some will say this makes or break a Mexican place. If this is you, then you may not LOVE it like I do. I enjoy the hottest sauce. Not cause i NEED heat, it just has the most flavor for me.

The pico is weak. Just basic stuff here. Nothing AMAZING. now Im not syaing put mangos in it, or A TOM of lime. Its just missing somthing. Im not sure waht. The middle sauces are ok. Nothing memorable. If i had one piece of advice for Panchos to help them get the respect they deserve, change the salsa bar up a little. Add more salsa, and serve the other stuff on an order basis. Give me flavors and heat.

I really decided to write this after having some EPIC, EPIC food from a place in Davis. they had 9 or 10 salsas. 10!!!! yes 10!! Orange, strawberry, mole, hot, sweet, mango, etc. JuST SOOO GOOD. to try half burrito dripping sauce all over them experimenting with flavor.

Panchos---do this. Take the kings seat you so deserve.

Burritos smal or large are great, enchilladas are not on the menu but dam good. (i think they have it printed on a sign somewhere)

for quick good food, with great help and a smiling face when you leave, go here. Its worth it.  PICK UP is mad fast too!
author: Benjamin W.

description:
Came here while driving down Geary and needed Mexican food. Went in and the dude that takes the order was too busy playing Mafia Wars on his iPhone to realize I was standing there. 

I told him my order three times before he remembered that it was chicken and black beans. 

Me: Chicken, with black beans... to go.
Dude:..... (flips his fingers left, right, up, down).. uhhh beef?
Me: Chicken
Dude: ....(fingers go up, up, down, down)..what kind of beans?
Me: Black beans
Dude:....(fingers go left, right, left, right)... chicken with black beans burrito?
Me: Yeah
Dude: ...(looks at his phone, makes a fist.. think he beat someone on Mafia wars) for here or to go?
Me: To Go...

Extra star just cuz the food tasted good. Service sucks.
author: Johnny D.

description: A solid place for a burrito in the city. The tortilla Is very fluffy, the rice is good however I felt cheated on the amount of chicken. For the price your getting something relevant but I would choose Papalote or Green chili kitchen over it any day. It's really if your in the area and want Mexican, it will do but there are always better options. Amazing chips though, thin, crunch, lightly salted and incredibly addicting
author: Matthias K.

description: The Carnita's Super Burrito was good enough to give you a "MONTEZUMA'S REVENGE"!
author: Matt G.

description:
I can't believe someone subtracted a star for the people who work there speaking "broken English". THIS IS SAN FRANCISCO, what do you expect? I lived in the central valley for years, and it's normal to go to a Mexican restaurant and have the cashier/cooks speak not so perfect English. As long as they're friendly and you can communicate with them, I don't see the issue. 

Pancho's is all I need considering there are no other alternatives in the area. I think the burritos are pretty damn decent and the meat isn't questionable. It's all I could ever ask for.
author: Tanis H.

description:
Albert Einstein once said, "The definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results". The English Oxford Dictionary defines 'procrastination' as delaying or postponing action, or something to that effect.

So, to put those things into context, I kept coming here despite initially not liking it, and felt insane every time I ordered to-go and then kicked myself for a mediocre experience. And then, I procrastinated on giving this place a poor review, as I many times wanted to.

Therefore, the good news is I can now quit procrastinating on writing a bad review of this place and finally write a GOOD one, since I have now continued to come here enough times in the past few weeks that I have come to appreciate the finer things on their menu, such as the Borracho Burrito (chicken or steak, black beans, cheese, guac, "Mexican BBQ sauce", and rice on a chile-flavored tortilla), or their Two Taco Combo Plate (chicken or steak, comes with rice, beans, salad, and chips).

These are good, hearty, and solid meals that fill me up quickly at the end of a long day. Easy on the wallet, too. I appreciate the salsa bar, with three main distinct salsas ranging in heat from mild to hot; and by hot they do mean hot.

Now, you may ask skeptically, "Why the change of heart, Anna S.?" And I will tell you: I came here at first because it is the closest place to get a burrito near my new place. It was like the metaphorical rebound date to the previous romances of my life, like Pancho's on Polk, or any number of the Mission taquerias. It is even closer to me than Gordo's. 

With summer school and the new job, plus a hearty appetite fueled by my insatiable craving for Mexican food, I've been looking for an easy Mexican meal to take home lately. And as I keep coming back, my insanity is paying off... the service is getting friendlier, the portions are getting larger, the guac is getting chunkier, and the salsa is tasting more flavorful... I have reached a happy agreement with this place.
author: Anna S.

description:
When I was a grad student in SF, I ate at Pancho's weekly. And by weekly, I mean at least 3 times a week. Sometimes twice a day. Hey, I was also pregnant and Pancho's was my version of pickles and ice cream. 

I love Pancho's for what is is - great Mexican food that is fresh, fast, and cheap. Even when they have a line out the door, the service is great. The guys behind the counter quickly got to know me and my favorites (chicken fajitas, veggie fajitas, carne asada tacos, and mahi mahi tacos). They make their own corn tortillas and chips, which are perfection. Seriously. I have yet to find better tortilla chips. And I think they always threw in a few extra chips for me, too. It sometimes pays to be a pregnant chick. Or just a chick, in general. 

The salsa bar is also a great concept and they always had quite a few salsa varieties. The seating is limited, so you might want to do take-out if you see a long line. The location is also good since there is usually street parking right in front or on the side street. 

Now that I'm in SoCal I'm really missing you, Pancho. And if you start shipping those chips, I'll love you forever.
author: Aimee G.

description: "We were somewhere around the The Pig & Whistle when the drun-gries (drunk hungries) began to take hold.  Pancho's was our only beacon of hope amongst the murmuring city lights and the cackling inebriated stumbles that enslaved our bodies.  But their burritos were serviceable enough, a sloppy cocoon of guacamole slathered cow product that had been packed and pummeled with a cornucopia of onions and legumes; sustenance you could carry as we made our way to the Buckshot like so many Americans before us." -The Writer Formerly Known as Hunter S. Thompson
author: Michael D.

description:
A neighborhood joint that I've enjoyed for many years, I'm at Pancho's about once a month.  It's pretty much the only Mexican food joint for anybody who lives in Laurel Heights/almost Inner Richmond (what I call the blocks before you hit Arguello.  Seriously, between Masonic and Arguello, we really lack identity).  

I used to love Gordo's, but realized that their burritos are what they do well and I have gravitated toward tacos, probably for life.  Pancho's does tacos yummy.  Me likey.  One thing, though: what's up with the sour cream that is so thick, it spreads?  

And I really like the chips, with a little cup combo of the super super hot salsa on the far right and the medium red salsa in the middle.
author: Tamar D.

description:
We brought some friends here last night on the recommendation of a friend. She said "I've lived in the city for 5 years and this is the best mexican food ever". Did it hold up? It certainly did. 

First, the burritos are HUGE. I was only able to eat half and so brought the other half for lunch. 

The guacamole s delicious! And the burritos aren't overly, beany, ricey, meaty, cheese, runny, etc... It was the perfect combination of everything!

The chips are also really. We'll definitely be back to try more of the menu.
author: Stephanie V.

description:
Stopped by here and there wasn't that many people inside.  The food was very fresh, but didn't have too much flavor.  It was okay - not bad, but not great either.  

The chips were good because they were thin and crispy with a little bit of salt.  

The place was clean but the food took a while to get done.  My bf and I ordered a fajita burrito and two mahi mahi tacos.  I understand that mahi mahi tends to take longer to cook but four people after us got their food before we did.  I was a little bothered by that.  Oh well.  I don't know if I would ever go out of my way to eat here again, but it's a decent spot!
author: Jennifer N.

description:
I'm usually a Gordo's gal.  As I live a block away, it's more a love of convenience than anything else.  But when the moon is full and the urges overwhelm the laziness, I can't help but lust deeply for Pancho.  Pancho which truly excites the senses, Pancho which always leaves me desiring for more, more, more!  Just the mere thought of the tender chicken bits and the aromatic rice gets me wet... in my mouth.  And so, I tuck my Gordo-guilt away, avert my eyes when I pass its storefront, and make the extra 20 block trek to visit my illicit paramour.

Haha.

Forreal though, their burritos are unfuckwithable.  Is it the best in the city?  I'll let the burrito-connoisseurs duke it out.  Meanwhile, you can find me five blocks away, sprawled in the deepest lush of grass at Golden Gate Park, consummating the holiest of unions: Sunny Day, Woman, and Savory Burrito.

Forgive me, Gordo's, but a girl has needs.
author: Teresa K.

description: Very good, but not extraordinary, neighboorhood taqueria.  Pleasant seating, above-average taqueria fare.  Recommended for lunch if you work in the neighborhood.
author: Josh B.

description:
So clean inside.  

I had the grilled mahi mahi tacos ($7.65 two per order) and they were very good.  Fish was nice.  Sloppily put together but I got take out. 

Salsas weren't hot enough, but just get more jalapenos.  

Will be back from now on.
author: Mrs F.

description:
Since I now live in the Laurel Heights area, Mexican food has become a scarce commodity. I came here with the hopes of striking gold!

Well, the vein has run dry. While they did have really good chips and salsa bar, the rest of my meal was lacking. I ordered a quesadilla & bean and rice burrito combo plate. The quesadilla was really good and filled with delicious cheese. The burrito on the other hand was taken home to be savored later. To my own dismay the aforementioned "bean & rice" burrito was filled with sketchy lettuce and tomatoes. WTF?!? A huge disappointment to say the least.

While not the best experience, I'll try and give them a second chance in the future.
author: Gary T.

description:
Oh, Pancho's how I love your Burracho burrito, stuffed full of delicious guacamole, beans, rice, meat (or replacement) of choice and your magical bbq sauce!  How are your chips always so warm and salty? Your salsa so fresh?

This is a must try in the city.  Papalote's may be great, but they don't have the Burracho burrito.
author: Brodie J.

description:
It's not a real mission burrito, but it will suffice.

I usually get a small carnitas burrito, on a spinach tortilla with black beans.

If you're in the mood to stuff your face, go for the BURRACHO. The sweety BBQ sauce goes well with the steak. 

Other than that, there isn't much.
author: Rommel P.

description:
Okay, remember those tacos I spoke of before???

Guess what, it's Tuesday and I am one unhappy woman.
Crampy, Feverish, and Achy all over...

Yes, my friends, IT"S FOOD POISONING!
author: J A.

description: Way over priced for the amount of food you get. Quality is decent  so one star for that and location is decent with parking on side streets so one star for that. Minus one star for being fairly over priced for items and minus one star for extremely small portions. As for being greeted, I didn't get greeted even though the store was empty so minus one star for that. So if your in a pinch and your stomach is telling you to eat then eat but their are better places to support.
author: Mike G.

description:
You've heard my "Woe betide the dearth of decent burritos in yonder Land O' Port wah wah" lament before. I'll spare you. But I have to admit, when I wrote Real Damn Mexican Food on my list of foods not to be missed in San Francheesy, I just assumed that I'd find it in the Mission. Home of the Mission-style burrito. Home of a taqueria on every corner, at a one to five psycho bike messengers ratio. 

I underestimated the big green sign announcing the presence of Pancho on the cusp of the Inner Richmond and Laurel Heights. You can find fried rice and beaded house slippers in just about every store window in this area of town, but not as many burritos. But I will not make the mistake of judging a taqueria by its neighborhood again. Try the Borracho burrito. Sweet, Mexican-style barbecue sauce over the meat of your choice along with rice, guac, and beans, all neatly tucked in a festive chile tortilla. If I could develop the power of flight, I'd soar over to Portland with the Borracho as my stratosphere snack, knock on the door of the junky Mexican joint near the freeway exit, and say, "Ur burrito, ur doin it wrong."

An argument involving color, valor, and all the truths we learn during preschool art experimentation arose, but I'll spare you that, too. Suffice to say, this stop on my culinary checklist agREeD with me.
author: Kimberly V.

description: tried the steak and chicken taco plate. generous servings, salsa bar is solid, but nothing special here other than that there aren't any other mexican places nearby.
author: Sherman L.

description: If you are in need for a quick fast meal this is a great place to stop. t's clean and everything is made fast. Prices are standard and i find the people who work there have been friendly. The only reasons for the 3 stars are because you know the people who work there can actually make better food than what they are asked to make there... and they know it too. But I do really like the chips :D and of course I will be back, cant beat a good clean restaurant.
author: Star Z.

description:
A-OK is right. Hot salsa worthy of clearing my sinuses. As others have indicated I will concur that the salsa bar and chips are probably the best part of this place. 

I got a grilled chicken burrito which was not the best I've had and not the worst. They have assorted interesting framed knickknacks on the wall, which were kind of cool. A Star Wars comic in Spanish, what? And dancing skeletons. Yes, I've resorted to rating the wall ornaments.

Go for the salsa, and don't wuss out. Get the hot stuff!
author: Ken L.

description: I was inspired to write a review after eating a Carnitas burrito from this place. I don't know what kind of Mexicans they are but this is the only place I have been to that serve "boiled" pork as carnita. No seasoning, just boiled, dry, tough, flavorless, pork.
author: Daniel D.

description:
The only way to make up for the fact they charge you $8.90 for two tacos & a root beer is to bankrupt them by taking eleventy billion sides of hot sauce when you visit. 

Viva La Revolucion!

Seriously though, the tacos are way below average and the whole place feels like the red-headed stepchild of Tacos Del Mar. 

Amigos, take my advice and save your $$$.
author: matt m.

description: Nothing fancy, but if you're just looking for a good 'ol burrito, tostada or taco, this place will fulfill your needs. It's right around the corner which also doesn't hurt. I recommend calling in during busy lunch or dinner hours.
author: S. L.

description:
I am a burrito connesiour. These burritos are not that great. Nothing special at all. I have some friends who LOOOOOOOVE this place so I end up going sometimes because of that and because it's close to USF for a quick bite between classes.

So, last time I was here I went up to the counter and asked for extra chips (after I had already sat down and started eating) and the guy told me to go stand in line (there were like 10 people waiting) and ORDER more that I would have to PAY for. WTF???? For like, 15 extra chips? You have GOT to be kidding me.

My advice: GO TO PAPALOTE on Fulton x Masonic. Papalote burritos are a gift from God. Papalote puts poor old Pancho to shaaaaame.
author: Chantal H.

description:
I used to go to the Pancho's on Polk when I worked in Pac Heights and the burritos/tacos/etc are mediocre and overpriced - 6 dollars for two tacos is just inexcusable in this taqueria economy. 

However, they have a wonderful chicken soup that is just like my momma makes, with lots of carrots, rice and shredded chicken. Only theirs is better because they put avocado on it and give me a warm tortilla to eat it with. But that's just between us.
author: Maria D.

description:
While I was waiting for my order at FedEx/Kinko's across the street, I thought I'd distract myself from having a nervous breakdown by finally eating lunch at 3 pm. 

Carnitas burrito w/o the beans b/c dude I was on my way to give a presentation. I didn't need to worry about gas on top of it all. Last I checked, carnitas were supposed to be shredded and not a massive hunk of pork. They're also supposed to be super flavorful. Pretty pathetic rice, cheese, lettuce, and salsa. Way too expensive for a crappy burrito. BUT...edible.  2 stars.
author: Steph P.

description:
The food in here is quite good, but there is a lot of competition for a place like this in San Francisco. They have a couple of unusual menu items, like the Atomic Burrito and the Borracho Burrito. They have a very nice chicken soup, Sopa de Pollo - "home made," whatever that means when you are getting it in a restarurant.

The reason that I am giving them only THREE STARS is that the last time I was in there, one of their guys started sweeping around my table as I was sitting there, kicking up dust ... THEN he gets out a mop that had, I don't know, maybe bleach or ammonia, or some other powerful industrial-strength chemical in it. Well, it stunk, and completely overwhelmed the taste of my food. All I could taste was chemicals. Stupid, stupid, stupid!
author: John H.

description:
I love my new neighborhood and all, but what is with the lack of Mexican food around here?!

Enter Pancho's.

What you get is a mediocre burrito, watered-down salsas, and a bunch of soccer-mom-types pushing strollers with four screaming children.
author: P A U L.

description:
I've driven by Pancho's Salsa Bar & Grill many times on Geary wondering what is like to eat there.  My niece and I decide to have lunch on a day of errands.

We each get the Small Rice & Bean burrito and the Small Grilled Steak burrito.  By itself, the burrito gets 3 stars as the flavor is bland (except the steak).  I bump it to 4 stars since there is a salsa bar which we turn up the spice in both burritos.  We both agree that the salsa verde is the best choice.  Also 4 stars on offering a smaller burrito which hits the spot.  My niece would have eaten a regular burrito since she was famished, but the small burrito was just right.

Also I had the fresh Mexican Horchata drink.  This drink is 5 stars.  The Horchata is a rice and cinnamon drink which is delicious and refreshing served cold.  A must have!
author: Janet H.

description:
Pancho's has a lot going for it.  The fact that I live right next to it won't affect how partial I am to the review, honest.

First and foremost, the chips are GREAT.  As much as I adore Taqueria Can-Cun and El Farolito, their chips are awful, and yes: this does make a big difference with your order.  Theirs are homemade, thin, and crispy - sometimes, I get a craving for their chips and salsa as much as I get a craving for a burrito itself.  They've got just enough salt, but don't leave a film of micron-thin salt crystals on your fingers like Can-Cun or El Farolito's do.

Which leads me to the second point: their hot salsa is worth the cost of entrance alone.  God damn, is it awesome.  They could jar the stuff and sell it.  I sure as hell would buy it.  I'd drive across town to the one place that sold it to buy a jar, I really would.  All their salsas are homemade.  The medium salsa is a bit weak, but still has a good flavor to it.  The salsa verde is quite good as well; somewhat spicy, tangy with the tomatillos fully pronounced.  The pico de gallo is pico de gallo: fresh.

They also have a creamy chipotle salsa to die for, but you have to ask for it.  if you ask them, they'll put it AND the hot salsa in the burrito.  Do this.

Third: their burritos are wicked good.  Seriously.  Their rice is tastier than any other taqueria rice I've had, and the quality of their dairy (sour cream and cheese) is better than most other places, too: the sour cream is much thicker than the viscous stuff they whap in tortillas at most other places.  The cheddar is mild but has flavor.  Despite the full-flavor of their dairy, their burritos aren't greasy - my only real gripe with Can-Cun and El Farolito.  Thier burritos are amazing, but the food coma is something else, and it feels like that greasy burrito is in your stomach for the next thirty-odd hours.  Pancho's are light, but not in that yoga-mat sort of way.

The only gripe I can possibly come up with about their burritos is that they're a big less fat than a Mission taqueria's.  That said, though, I've never felt like I was missing out on portion size.

The atomic burrito is great: a burrito mojado in a chile tortilla (which doesn't taste any more or less spicy; it's more for aesthetics, I think) and lathered in a spicy enchilada sauce.  Definitely worth a go once or twice.

And now, if I can just step up on this soapbox a moment...

There are multiple reviews here that give the place one star and mention the clientele as part of the reason they don't like the place. It's in the Inner Richmond: people here have families, so don't be shocked if there's *gasp* A CHILD!!! sitting in a booster seat at one of the tables.  If you don't like that, there's a bar to the left wall you can sit at, or you can just sit at a table further away.  What's up with people here hating kids?  I actually like the mix of clientele here; it's the closest thing to an intercultural San Franciscan hugtime circle I've seen.  Everyone loves Pancho's; why don't you?  Is it *because* everyone else loves them?  Look, man: it's okay.  We *all* love Pancho's.  You know you do, too.

Also, the staff: everyone there is wicked cool.  I go there often enough and know them all well enough, and they're all good dudes.  Now, if you come at them like an entitled San Franciscan yupster food snob, they'll probably be less apt to be as prompt as they could be.  Plenty of times, some bespectacled, bald fellow in a $500 scarf has been up there and said in a wallowing vocal gait, "....sooooooo... I'm kiiiiiinda thinking of getting a carne asada burrito... buuuuuttttt.... mmmm... yeeeeah, how's the chicken today?  I'm only looking for white meat, mmkay?  I don't want to see any brown spots unless it's from the spices.  What sort of spices do you use?  Do you use mapuche spice?"  Look, man: this is a taqueria, not a suicide chat line or a monosyllabic-titled gourmet sit-down in Soma where the waiter went to finishing school in Marseilles.  Maybe to you this seems normal, acceptable behaviour for lunchtime rush but 'round here, it's not.  That said, I know when the tall dude's prom is because he's all about preparing for it (he asked where I got my suit); I know the shorter dude likes Hondas because he asked if the S2000 outside was mine.  

Just be cool.  That's all you have to do.
author: Tristan S.

description:
Inexpensive. Quick. Good food. Serve beer.

I ordered a Steak Burrito which came with a side of chips. It was a decent sized burrito stuffed with steak, rice, black beans, and roasted peppers. They also have a salsa bar, all of which are freshly made and very tasty. I also noticed they have a decent selection of beers to go along with the burritos although I didn't get one when I went. The place was decently busy but it wasn't too hard to find a seat, and they open up the front facade on nice days. It was nothing too special but I would definitely recommend it.
author: U U.

description:
My favorite Mexican place around the Richmond. The prices are a bit more expensive then places you find in the Mission but the food is good and always fresh. 

I get the same thing here everytime. TACO'S! there taco's are soooooo good. I can't seem to order anything else because I love the taco's so much. Maybe Pancho's is bringing out some sort of obsessive compulsive behavior that I was completely unaware of. I will try to order something different next time but I have no doubt already that I will fail.
author: Patrick B.

description:
Much, much better burrito than Gordo's.  The portions are just the right size and they wrap them perfectly for a to-go order, if you have to say, walk 20 blocks down Geary to get home.   One of my biggest peeves about burritos is they put to much or too little sour cream / cheese, but here it's just right.  I wouldn't go as far to say "best non-mission", but it's certainly the best I've found on the west side of the city.

Oh, and what's this in the bottom of the bag?  Free homemade chips?  Oh yes!
author: John H.

description: I'm stunned by the mediocre reviews for Pancho's. This is my favorite taqueria anywhere, and the longer it's been since I lived in SF, the more I miss it. I would go just for the chips and guacamole, which are fantastic and thankfully cilantro-free. I usually get some kind of burrito; the ingredients always seem fresh, and it's one of the few taquerias where I trust the chicken 100%. The space itself isn't very big, and the line can get super long right after work, but the staff is friendly and there's plenty of light and a view of the action on Geary. And this may seem like a small thing, but I love that they have wet wipes with the utensils - after getting off the 38, the last thing I want to do is touch my food!
author: Rob B.

description:
Went to Bev. Mo. & decided to give Pancho's another chance. That was a mistake. 

Fattie behind the counter was grumpy as all hell, my burrito tasted like a taco bell burrito looks, and the salsa was pathetic.

Do Not Want.
author: jack p.

description: Perfectly OK.  Better than Gordos (which, honestly, isn't much of an endorsement.) Certainly it's a very nice, clean, well-run place.  The people working there are super-nice.  The chips are great.  The burrito was, erm, ok at best.  There was nothing particularly good about it.  The carnitas had a decent flavor, but poor texture (mushy.)  The salsa was good.  They have whole wheat and spinach tortillas, and black or pinto beans.  I guess in the end it's fine for what it is -- a basic, yuppie burrito.  If that's your thing, awesome.  If not, keep on looking, or lower your expectations appropriately.
author: Eric W.

description:
I live right next to a taqueria in the Richmond District but it's good to break out and visit other places for a burrito. I went to this place about a year or so ago and liked their burrito but didn't love it. So then I tried some of their  mahi tacos and really liked them and can't get them at my local place so that's a reason to visit. Next for me was trying their kitchen soup based on the recommendation of my good friend Joy A. This soup changed my life! If ever I'm feeling under the weather I head straight for this place and put down a large container of it. Their one cool feature is their salsa. They have a great selection of them and they are all excellent. 

Definitely worth the trip and even for a couple people to enjoy their cozy dining area.
author: Gabriel R.

description:
I don't know why I keep coming here - and I've been coming here quite a lot since it opened. I just had Chicken Fajita burrito and it was the BLANDEST thing I've ever had. It's overpriced (but then again it's in the Laurel Village area). And I think the prices has risen since the last time I was here. 

I have to convince myself to maybe order something else and give it one last shot (hence a 2 star rating). But I have to say, this is by far my least favorite taqueria in SF. If in the Richmond, you're best just to stick with Gordo's (or Chino's).
author: Ted P.

description:
The water was a little too cold (minus 1 star)
The watermelon juice was appropriately chilled (plus one star)
The decoration is cute (plus one star)
The guys working here speak broken English (one star mas)
It is appropriately dirty (plus one star)
Chips are below average (minus one star)
Food is decent in a pinch, but it's not Mission quality. 
Overall, I'd say it's "ok".
author: Senor Q.

description: After the sad burrit I had at Gordos, which I could barley eat. I still wanted to try a tasty burrito. I tried Pancho's. The man behind the counter was AMAZING. working so fast like he had just railed 3 a few lines. Very cool to watch. Got the Shrimp and Steak. Onions and Peppers made it Fantastic. Shit was goooood....I slept for hours!
author: Chelsey G.

description:
This is our regular spot for burritos.

Servers are friendly, burritos are very good and large.  We love the lightly salted thin tortilla chips.
author: Robert M.

description: I can't get enough of the salsa bar here.  Other than that, the food is decent.  The quesadillas and the burritos are pretty small, for the price.  The quesadillas barely have anything in them!  But again, I LOVE the salsa bar.  That's the only thing this place does right.
author: Vivian H.

description: Where to start , we'll first time walking in there I order a surf & turf (shrimp& steak) burrito . Already have eaten through half the burrito when I notice there is no shrimp he told me it's pre measured in a cup. The shrimp they use is the on a nickel. Worst burrito experience .
author: Glendy C.

description:
I remain sort of on the fence about this place. It's good... but not the first place I want to go to when I think of Mexican food.

Basically, it comes down to this - when I want Pancho's... I want Pancho's; they have a particular style that can be a good change of pace from other places I enjoy. This is not to say that their food is BAD, or even lacking in "authenticity" (to use the appropriate buzzword), I just tend to eat here far less than other Mexican places.
author: Alex C.

description:
The inner richmond isn't know for its quality Mexican food. I really hoped that Pancho's would prove me wrong. 

It definitely had all the ingredients to be a Mexican restaurant. Burritos, tacos, chips and salsa bar. But it just felt like a denny's cut in half and repainted with the generic Aztec warrior.

The food itself was also lacking. Maybe it was just the lack of 20 years of frier buildup that makes other places great or maybe its just that I've been treated to top-class mexican in the mission for so long but something just isn't right.

But if you're in the richmond and you need something of the non-asian  variety its a decent option.
author: Jesse B.

description:
How much do I love the salsa here?  I chug it.  Not kidding, I fill up a little cup and drink from it.  When one of the guys in the kitchen noticed what I was doing, he gave me a thumbs up.  That my friends is appreciation of salsa love.

I usually just get a large order of chips and about a pound of salsa and munch away.  They're chicken quesadilla and steak quesadilla are quite good.  But I kid you not, I could live on just their chips and salsa.
author: Heather H.

description: At first, I couldn't stop comparing it to my beloved Papalote. This is a completely take though- definitely a more authentic vibe. I do enjoy their chicken quesadillas and different sauce options for their yummy chips. A little oily but a solid lunch option (considering I work right above it =P)
author: Dana S.

description:
I admit, I have undeniable cravings for Pancho's on occasion.  Their burritos are great.  However, what snaps me back into the reality of a turkey sandwich lunch instead of a big, fat burrito is it's instant effect on my body.  

Flashback:  I'm at Pancho's, stomach is growling looking forward to the food.  It arrives.  I sit down and chow, chow, chow.  About 3/4 of the way thru the burrito, (gurble), my stomach makes an odd sound.  Get me some more of that (blurbby) sour cream.  Munch, munch...(gumblybraly).  Ow.  My stomach hurts.  BUT let me just get one more mouthful before (grawblypow) OW.  Must go home now.  Fast.

Maybe I should just get the food to go next time my cravings are too large to deny.
author: Karen C.

description:
I stop in here for dinner on my way home since it is right across the street from Bev Mo and I seem to run out of beer pretty often. This time was like no other. Except I had recently seen Ratatouille on my flight back from Boston a few days ago so I was seeing 'phantom mice' out of the corners of my eyes, much like I did when I moved into an apartment without cats, I saw 'phantom kitties'...little spots of movement only seen out of the corner of your eyes that disappear when you look at it full on.

Except this time.

NOT a phantom. It STARED at me before scuttling under the trash basin. I, of course being the sophisticated cosmopolitan woman that I am, screamed and jumped up from my seat bouncing up and down and blubbering "mouse, mouse, I saw a mouse!"!!! Due to the 4" stilettos and skirt I was wearing I decided against jumping up on the chair, but the thought did cross my mind. 

Waiting the next 6 minutes for my delicious carnitas burrito to be ready were interminable. What? You thought I would leave? Hell no. Then I'd have to figure out something else for dinner to wash down my Pacifico's with. Plus it was already paid for. It did give me some comfort that the door did happen to be open this day and the people working were generally concerned (the guy who came out with the dustpan kept muttering "no me gusta" while he hunted for it.)

I love the salsa bar too. I usually get one of everything then mix them all up together in a bowl when I get home. The tortillas are light and crispy (a little too light as they often break in the salsa) and not too greasy. 

Its a solid 4 star burrito. -1 for this one experience.
author: Brenda K.

description:
I eat here fairly often as I live right around the corner.  I am a huge fan of the steak and shrimp burrito, which is pretty much the only thing I eat from here.  Chips are good as are the various salsas.  I also appreciate they offer marinated/pickled veggies at the salsa bar. 

As with most people, there are better Mexican places out there for sure.  If this wasn't in my neighborhood, I probably wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.  That said, solid burrito, good location, good salsa.  It'll do.
author: Kent E.

description:
I first tried this place out several months ago when I was starving for some late dinner after seeing the movie Transamerica at the Bridge theatre a few blocks up. I visited Pancho's again today for lunch, and I am still very impressed with this place.

The menu is front and center, easy to understand. I went for Combination #2 for $6.95 with a chicken quesadilla, small bean and rice burrito (I don't know what was small about it - bigger than those frozen microwave burritos from Safeway), chips, and guacamole with shredded lettuce. Add in a large diet Coke from the fountain, and my bill came out to $9.17.

The food was very fresh and tasted good. I really enjoyed the chicken quesadilla with some of their medium red salsa. The medium red salsa deserves an award or something - it has just the right zing and is soooo tasty. I smothered everything in that salsa after this realization (what can I say, I'm a hillbilly at heart and grew up tossin' gravy on food).  Anyway ... the small burrito was more than just rice 'n beans - they added lettuce, sour cream, and maybe some other goodies - add the medium salsa, and yum-o! A very filling lunch.

The shop itself seems very clean - almost too clean for a mom & pop type place. It has a nice collection of photos on the walls, including one of Julio Iglesias (with autograph, I assume - didn't get too close to it). They do a good job of cleaning up tables once folks finish and leave.

The food was prepared quickly, as one would expect - so this is definitely a good spot to grab a quick bite of fresh, tasty mexican food.

I'd give it 5 stars, but $9.17 felt about $1above what I should've been charged for the food.  Whatever - it is still a nice spot to eat when in the area.
author: Jamie W.

description:
Looking for quick Mexican food that's not in the Mission?  Then if you are around the Laurel Heights area, this is the place.

The food is edible and reliable for burritos, tacos, and fajitas.  I love the chicken quesadilla here!
author: Alan T.

description:
Pancho's makes the best chips and their salsa bar is great!  Their fish tacos are excellent and the rice is good, too.  Try their sopa de pollo and their Atomic burrito, which has melted cheese all over it!  

It's also super tidy!  Check it out!
author: M L.

description:
i've been driving by this place for years, finally i had to cruise on in and check it out.

as far as burritos go, this one was a plain jane.  there's so many ingredients in the burrito -yet it just left me wanting to pour something inside of it to give the burrito some flavor.

salsa bar was ok, lacked carrots. the staff mine as well have been those mechanical chuck e cheese characters that randomly dance.
author: Ameer N.

description: Bomb snap burritos!! AND they got watermelon aguas frescas...
author: Justin E.

description:
When I know I'm going broke, I go here.
When I want a decent quesadilla, I go here.
When I crave for chips and homemade salsa, I go here. 
When my friends say "I feel like getting Mexican tonight," I go here.
It's inexpensive and it reminds me of La Victoria's back at home. 
Thanks Pancho's!
author: Jasleen K.

description:
Good (but not great) Mexican for the price.

They forgot one of our items on a pick up order so we had to circle the block until they made it.

Chips were half stale.
author: laura g.

description:
No competition for the Mission here.  Burrito was average; horchata was unimpressive as well.  However, no big complaints.  
Just average.  
Ho hum.
author: Robby T.

description:
Nothing really here amazed me. 

I like their 'homemade' chips, made from leftover stale tortillas, deep fried. But aside from that I'll pass and go somewhere else next time.
author: Derrick L.

description: Good menu. Fast. Moderately priced. Taste good. It's hard to get Mexican food wrong, really.
author: Timothy L.

description:
For some reason I don't seem to like this location as much as I like the Polk St. one.  The food is the same, but it lacks a certain something.  I stick with the tacos though, as they make a decent fish taco.

Good thing is that people are nice, and I think this one might be a but larger then the other, but has a completely different layout.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
What I like about this place: whole wheat tortillas for burritos, whole pinto beans as an option, the hot salsa in the salsa bar, the Empire Strikes Back sign in Spanish.

What I don't like: nothing, really. It's pretty solid.

What I don't like that has nothing to do with the restaurant: if it's busy, and you're by yourself, don't take up a table for 8. Seriously, that's just stupid.
author: Kristen H.

description:
Oh man oh man oh man..this place is so GOOD to my tummy.

I love, no I LUST for their tacos. I can down 4 of em' in one sitting. Then, I usually have to go home and take a nap, but its so worth it.

I just tried their Borracho burrito..holy smokes.

 Forget the nap. Couch bound with remote in hand and I'm callin' it a day!

BTW, they have those little containers of salsa..I stock up on the salsa  and take them home. 

So good on my eggs for breakfast!
author: First C.

description: The BBQ chicken burrito is the only thing I ever order from here and it is really frickin good.  Chile tortilla, delicious bbq sauce, tasty chicken and all the burrito fixins.
author: Christina S.

description: We go to Pancho's about once a month. We've never been disappointed in the food. We usually do take out --it's fast and easy. their Burracho Burritos are a family favorite!  We've found the people that work there to be friendly and efficient as well.
author: Carol O.

description:
I love this place. I've been to many a delightful Taqueria in the Mission, but they don't really compare to the  quality, fresh, healthful (it's available), food here. It's clean inside, the people that work there are SO sweet, there are so many options, they're open later... it's just really good. The only thing is that it can be considerably pricier than most places like it, but for quality- it's worth it. 
I recommend the Tostadas and Fajitas. Gotta ask for hot sauce. 
Great for kids too- it's a totally colorful and friendly atmosphere.
author: R J.

description: I'm working nearby so I went here for lunch, got a burrito & it was a complete waste of money. The shrimp were very small, they didn't have any flavor, the whole burrito was horrible. I'm extremely disappointed & will never be going back here again.
author: Jade D.

description:
No, no, no. This isn't a burrito. Try Gordo's further west on Geary. 

Pancho's just doesn't seem authentic to me, it doesn't taste authentic either. The only good part about this place is the free chips and salsa bar.
author: Justin B.

description:
Two words:  borracho burrito.  

Minus a star for the 2 or 3 times I ordered mine with steak (to-go) only to discover later that it was made with chicken instead, even though my receipt said steak.  c'est la vie.  I do agree that sometimes the food can be bland, but I like that they give you chips and have a salsa bar.  The chicken soup is very hearty and comforting when you're sick.  They're also open till 11pm during the week, which is nice.
author: asia c.

description: the #1 is a must try! i get it with grilled chicken. they make the tortillas by hand in front of you. and the chicken is from a whole breast that they grille and chop in front of you. it has plenty of flavor and i love the spicy dark red salsa they offer.
author: Scott P.

description:
we went here with some friends and ordered a chicken and a steak mini burritos. there was one diff, he went back to ask for habaneros on his. 

the burritos were fantastic

his chicken burrito w/habaneros burned, seriously burned.
[it might be a good idea to take some antacid (maalox, pepto, etc...) if you plan on having the hot peppers in your food] 

with a bite of his burrito we downed quite a bit of horchata as well as chips & sour cream.  it was still a fun and tasty experience. i'm sure we will be heading back in no time

parking is not that easy in the area
author: Anita J.

description:
This is my favorite place to eat Mexican food at. The orders are priced okay, but the it is well worth it because the food is freshly made and made right off the bat.

When I'm here I order a simple burrito, tostada shell, or try the soup. Either choices taste great. Carnitas are well-cooked too. That reminds me, they have salsa bar like most Mexican restaurants, but unlike some, they don't give "unlimited" servings. 
Once I was ordering to-go for a big group of people when I remembered that I had a specific command to make sure to get salsa for the food while I was there. I was curious to see whether they would tell me to limit my servings simply because, I was only one person. But no, in fact, when they saw me, they gave me more chips! I was very grateful for that, along with the group I was ordering for.
author: Tara V.

description:
Back from a long yelp hiatus to give this place the review it deserves.

I've lived within two blocks of this place for a year and finally tried it. That in itself was, in retrospect, a sign. I had a feeling. I should have trusted it.

Ordered: Chicken Burrito.

Immediate reaction upon unwrapping it was bad. Totally floppy, gummy feeling flour tortilla. 

First bite - is this all actually freshly prepared food?

Second bite - cold lettuce meets bland chicken meets other equally bland ingredients.

Third bite - I paid for this, I will consume it for the caloric value.

Yes, people, I tried the salsas. They were decent. They did not rise to "good", and they were certainly not good enough to overcome one of the most terribly TERRIBLY sub-par (I wanted to say mediocre, but this place is not ruling the 50th percentile of mexican food) burritos I've ever had.

TRY HARDER.
author: r g.

description: My husband & I go here at least once a month. Great burritos and I love the chicken soup. I highly recommend for lunch.
author: jennifer c.

description: Ordered the grilled chicken nachos, wasn't impressed. Barely any chicken and mostly greasy chips. Paid $10 which I thought was pricey and the taste itself was just okay. Definitely been to way better Mexican spots, don't think I'd come back here.
author: Kimberly W.

description:
If the burdens of a full-time job, money, or other commitments make it hard for you to take a trip to Mexico, then go to Pancho's. (after you decide the Mission is too far away)

Their burritos are massive. My boyfriend (who really could eat everything under the sun and still want dessert) couldn't finish the Atomic burrito in one sitting. I chose the *small* chicken burrito and was satisfied (if you know what I mean. No? neither do I). 

Their nachos are also heavenly and their salsas are bueno. Good eats all around.
author: Ali L.

description: Read the reviews, figured it was worth a shot.  Won't go back.  The folks working here were nice and helpful, but $18 for a burrito and two tacos is not reasonable especially when neither had a lot of flavor.
author: Scott K.

description:
i just ate the worst veggie tacos of my life in this place. it was a small amount of steamed vegetables on a corn tortilla with some shredded lettuce. that's it. no beans, no rice, no salt, no oil, no guacamole, no salsa, no spices, no flavor whatsoever. wanted to take it back, didn't take it back. just paid $7 for that. ouch. 

the last time i was there they charged me extra to get beans on my vegetarian burrito. think about it...
author: zachary p.

description:
What's the matter? Tortillas too CORN for you? This place is perfect for someone like me. I'm more of a taco person as opposed to a burrito person...

Anyway, I had the carnitas tacos. The homemade tortillas had a nice heft to them. The meat was delicious and had a nice seasoned taste that I can't put my finger on...a hint of cloves maybe?

My girlfriend had a quesadilla...it was pretty standard. So I imagine the burritos aren't too special either.

Stick with the corn tortillas and don't douse your stuff in cheese. But you should be doing that anyway, right?
author: Derek B.

description: I like the food here, but they have attempted to overcharge me on multiple occasions (in excess of $4).The girl working at the cash register cannot count. I recently showed her the math and had her redo a transaction only to check my account later to find she applied someone else's drink to my card (an additional incorrect transaction) after I left. Completely absurd. Going to try and cancel the charges. Could tolerate at first, but as of today I am never going back here again
author: Gaven Y.

description:
This was one of my favorite (nearby) spots during college. The burritos were consistent and they didn't card for beer. I recently came back here and found it pretty disappointing. Not disgusting, just boring and bland. 

We had a chicken burrito and a steak and shrimp burrito. I'd give the chicken one 2 stars and the steak/shrimp 3.5 stars. Maybe my tastes have changed in the last few years, but the burritos were bland, full of too much rice and without pouring salsa on every bite I don't know that I would've finished them. 

The chips were still fantastic (love homemade chips) and the salsa bar was still awesome, so not all was lost. I'll probably come back and try an old standby like the burracho burrito just to make sure this time wasn't a fluke. 

However, they are on very thin ice with me. If they do me wrong one more time I will break up with them forever. I can buy my own beer now.
author: Thor M.

description:
It's not the best place for Mexican food...but it is convenient on Geary and the staff is usually very nice. 

The food is slightly overpriced and they often adjust their pricing. All and all though, its not bad.
author: A. S.

description: Pancho's is a great neighborhood restaurant and a yummy Mexican restaurant.  The guacamole is some of the best I've had, and so are the chips.  The food is delicious and they're really friendly.  This is a must-have place when I'm really busy.
author: Kathleen D.

description:
Update:  I really can not eat here anymore.  Maybe I am burnt out on their burritos (not burritos in general) but their food just isn't good anymore.  I tried to venture out and try other things at Pancho's but I just realized I don't like their food.  They just don't have as much flavor as other burrito spots.  They still have good salsa but sorry to say Pancho's will not be seeing me anytime soon  

I live about three blocks away from this place so when I'm craving a burrito, about three times a week, I usually walk to Pancho's.  I love the salsa bar because you can stock up on as much salsa as you need, I like the green salsa the best there.  I always get the beans and rice burrito because it is only $3.95 and I would have to say is very tasty.  The place is pretty crowded every time I go there but I would have to say that the service is very fast.  I give Pancho's a four thumbs up!
author: Julie D.

description:
Eating the Borracho Burrito is like eating your favorite ice cream: it tastes better than anything, even if it does pack in the calories!

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to get an authentic mexican food fix.  As a grad student at USF, I find myself pinching pennies more than usual these days... which is why I'm never disappointed with Panchos - they are quick, not too pricey, and I usually end up with leftovers!

Just make sure that you are walking or riding a bike during traffic hours, because parking can be a nightmare.  Also, I wouldn't suggest sitting inside on warmer days, because it tends to be stuffy, and the tables are kind of cramped together... unless you like eating in stranger's laps.
author: Jenni D.

description:
No, we're not in the hipster soon to be yuppie Mission so set your expectations accordingly.  This place is in that weird twilight zone area being kicked around by Laurel Heights and Inner Richmond. Somewhere between the nicely manicured streets of Commonwealth and concrete sprawl of Geary lies one of the few if not only Mexican places within a 10 block area.

So here's why I like Pancho's, if not only for the dearth of other easily accessible food.

It's the only convenient take out joint around my home and the 38 Geary deposits me right at their door step.

The service has always been pleasant.

The food is pretty tasty. Iif you want a decent burrito or some nachos drowning in cheese and real guacamole, and fresh salsa, you can't beat it. They are just as good as some of the Mission joints.

And, they make their corn tortillas to order for their tacos. I love this stuff. It's chewy and substantial and holds the filling nicely. No ripped up dripping tacos for me.
author: Y C.

description:
Unless you live in the Mission your choices of SF Mexican food include: Gordo's and their squares of cheese they lay in burritos or, Tommy's where the food is awful but you can't tell bc you are wasted from fantastic pitchers of margaritas.

Well Pancho's is great Mexican and while its style is in comparison to Gordo's its food is much better. I highly recommend it - parking is relatively easy in this area and they is good seating inside.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Clean, nice, cheap, burritos in my inner richmond.... gracias, pancho.
PS: I'll give you an extra star if you make a medium sauce that is not mild or full of cilantro... or even if you just get a bottle of Tapatio on the counter.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Overall, a decent place to grab a quick bite of mexican food. There food is food is passable, but nothing to get excited about. I've definitely had better mexican food. Also, there prices are a bit high for their quality of food as well. I usually grab a burrito or tacos from here. The thing is that this is one of the few mexican places in the area so there isn't too much to choose from. I would recommend going to green chile kitchen or papalote's instead.
author: Ajay K.

description:
By far - the WORST Burrito in San Francisco.

The tortilla was too thick, the hot sauce tasted like shit, the guacamole was brown (and cost extra), the sour cream looked like cream cheese and the meat was dry.  If you're in the area and you want Mexican food, go to taco bell down the street, I guarantee it tastes better and costs less.  This place is so bad I'm recommending Taco Bell.

This place is a disgrace to all San Francisco Taquerias!
author: Justin O.

description:
Went here on a spur of a moment lunch trip with some co-workers. We were all craving mexican food but most especially, BURRITOS! One of them mentioned her friend recommended the place, so we decided to check it out. 

Being raised in the Excelsior district, I am accustomed to the various mexican restaurants/fares in or around the Mission. However, when I tasted my carne asada burrito from Pancho's, I was clearly not impressed! Not only was the burrito dry but I was bummed that I had to pay extra for cheese, sour cream and guacamole!!! It just did not have the authentic taste of the burritos from a typical taqueria. Also, the burrito was half the size and cost twice as much. 

One star for fast service and one star for the parking we got in front of the restaurant.
author: La C.

description:
Ok. Let me just say that I hit this place up more often than I'd like to admit,  and it's not super stellar but if you stick to a few key menu items you will generally not be disappointed. I go for the carne asada fajita burrito (sin arroz, sin frijoles) the plain old quesadillas (either flour or corn) and much to my thighs' dismay have recently added the carne asada torta to my list.

I think I'm a decent judge of Mexican food, being that my parents are Mexican, I travel to the motherland a lot and I was born and raised in East LA and I'm telling you this is not great Mexican food, but it is tasty, reasonably priced, and fills yer tank up good.
author: stephanie c.

description:
This place wins big-time on location, easily walkable from my place.  My girlfriend declared it "baja-style", and I agree.  Very different genre of Mexican when compared to the places in the Mission, Gordo's, Papalote, and the like.

We were really excited about the chicken soup, but found it to be flavorless with ingredients that weren't even entirely cooked (e.g. the onion).  To me, it tasted like they  had just run out, then we ordered it, so they threw some water and ingredients right out of the fridge into a pot, heated it up, put some boiled shredded chicken (with no fat) in, and then served it with a couple of slices of avocado.  It wasn't bad, it just had no flavor, which is, I suppose, bad for some definition thereof.

The steak nachos were good.  Beans are like refried with pinto chunks sprinkled throughout.  Steak was tasty, one of the highlights of the place.  The steak mixed with beans was my favorite thing about the meal.

The steak burrito, similar to nachos re: beef with bean mix was good.  The cheese was the thin-grated type and I enjoyed it but something strange happened to the tortilla, wherein it was gummy and slick along one side.  It stuck to my teeth as a result and was pretty unpleasant.

I'll come back due to proximity, and we look forward to trying the many other items on the menu such as tortas.  Unfortunately, I'd rather eat at Gordo's or Papalote most of the time, even if they're somewhat farther away.
author: Walter K.

description: The burritos at Pancho's are expensive and small compared to the ones you can get in the Mission.  But if you can't make it out there, Pancho's is okay.  I recommend the steak and shrimp burrito.  Their tortilla chips are light, crispy, and perfectly salted.
author: Anthony H.

description: This would be the place to go to if I'm doing errands and want a burrito quick fix. Sadly, I'm the type that likes just black bean burritos, the guy making it, I guess is so used to putting rice on the burrito, he didn't realize that my order was just black beans. He took the tortilla, shook it off and started again. My order may seem anal, but I'm not an anal person because I understand you shouldn't waste food. My order came out to be 5.95, not worth it for the type of burrito. At least Gordos gives you a hearty potion for their regular sizes. The ingredients though from what I saw, looked fresh, that in itself validates the 3 stars, for my two star meal.
author: Peta C.

description:
Listen Up Hot and SPICY fans- this place is the bomb!  I love to eat here frequently!  This is the only place in the CITY that has fresh Habenero peppers- they will add them to your burrito or whatever you like!
Its sad but true, spice fans- every other mexican grill that I have visited in SF does not have these famously hot tasty peppers- 
I frequently get the Boracho- its a burrito with special sauce- YUM!
author: Jack J.

description:
I came here only because my good friends RAVED about the chicken soup.  And although they give all white meat and lots of it (I ordered the small size), the broth lacks VIDA!! Vida means LIFE and if your Latina, SOUP is LIFE alot of the times.  Even with added onions, cilantro, salt, and a few chunks of avocado, for which I had to pay extra, it was still LIFELESS.  It wasn't the worse that is why I give them 2 stars, the lady at the counter LOVED my hair and that deserves some LOVE.  Oh, and ONE tortilla the size of a CD, just felt RUDE!

My chicken soup is a million times better, now, if I can only find more time to make it!  I will not be going back.  

Oh, no corn in my soup but tons of celery, totally not traditional in Mexican or overal Latin.
author: Bahvee V.

description:
Burrito's weren't great, service was worse.

If you want a good, affordable, and packed burrito, hit up Papalote on Fulton and Masonic, where their workers actually appreciate your business.
author: Tammy L.

description:
I'm not here to complain about the food, mostly because I never ended up receiving it.

Working from home, I called in an order for pickup.  My call was answered quickly and nicely, and I was told my burrito would be ready in 15 minutes.

When I arrived 15 minutes later, there was a line out the door.  Assuming this place's phone-in policy was equivalent to every other restaurant's phone-in policy, I stepped inside and proceeded directly to the cashier to pick up my order.

I guess a girls' soccer team must've just finished a game, because the place was crawling with them.  They were screaming, burping, and being all kinds of generally annoying.  On top of that, the couple at the front of the line rudely snapped at me for "cutting" when I tried to get the cashier's attention.  They could have been nicer about it, though apparently they knew the pickup policy requires waiting in line with the patrons who haven't yet ordered...  Seeing as my burrito must've been ready at that point, I wasn't about to wait in line for half an hour while it got cold.

Between the rude, annoying patrons and the disorganized pickup policy, I was fed up with the place.  I'll take my business elsewhere.
author: Matt B.

description:
This happened awhile ago, but it needs to be on here to warn all others.

So, for all those... a brief introduction to Julie B.  She is made of Chinese and Mexican blood.  yep.  weird combination, right?

Julie B. moved into the inner Richmond, and let's face it folks, that ain't no place for Mexican taqueria's... needless to say the Mexican came a' craving... and she went to pancho's.  BAD CHOICE.

The pricey plain carne asada burrito with rice and beans was cold... and it equaled a night kneeling to the porcelain gods.  Next time, Julie B will make the long trip to visit home, El Castillito in the Church and Market Area.
author: julie b.

description:
Pancho's is a solidly reliable, convenient stand-by. You can call ahead and have your order ready to pick up (but do check your bag before you get home - missing quesadilla = baaad)  .Or if you choose not to do that, you won't wait too long for you food, even when the line seems insufferably long. 

If I could give this place an extra 1/2 star, I would. It's consistent, and I appreciate the service. Many of the folks there have been on the staff for years - very friendly, eager to please. What prevents a 4-star rating is the fact that this certainly isn't the best Mexican fare I've had (refer to my rating of Los Compadres taco truck at Spear and Folsom), and the chips they're known for are sometimes stale and under-salted. If you're looking for more traditional plates, try the taquitos with rice and beans - it's a nice diversion from the usual burrito, as is the tostada.
author: Kiesha R.

description:
SF Food Inspection Score: 98

Definitely a fan, probably the best burritos in that area. They do have some awesome combinations that are the best bang for your buck.

I love their salsa bar, there's lots to choose from and there's plenty of room to hang out and eat. Still won't give it a 4 star because nothing is as good as Ocean Taq...Like I've said a billion times before.

When I'm in the Richmond craving burritos, I'll see you here.
author: Kristina C.

description:
Levels of Mexican Food Authenticity (highest to lowest)

Mexico City 
Tijuana
Tex-Mex
Cancun
San Diego
White-mex
Chinese dude grilling up my Burrito

This place is somewhere between chinese dude and White-mex.   
Overpriced and I think I saw a vegetarian option.....ALWAYS a bad sign at ANY ethnic restaurant (unless the enthnicity is vegetarian).

Crap on this over priced hole. Save your money and go to the mission and line up behind the other mexican's .
author: Spanky M.

description:
I love coming to this place... While in college this is where I got my fix for some good mexican food... Things I would order:

The Borracho Burrito (The marinade makes the steak very tender... a must have)

The Carne Asada Tacos (great homemade style tortillas with a citrus tasting carne asada)

The Steak and Shrimp Burrito (good combo of meat and seafood)

Any tortas they got (nice snack for you to have, you should get 2 instead)

Good grubbing especially if you're near USF. Check it out.
author: Miguel B.

description: I don't know what to say about this place.  I tried it once and it was pretty good and then when I tried it the second time around it was really terrible.  I had a burrito the first time that was good enough to bring me back in but when I ordered the enchiladas on the second visit they were awful.  In fact the rice and beans weren't even good.  I never ever salt my food and I actually had to do that because the food was absolutely tasteless.  I don't know what happened but unfortunately I wouldn't go back just for that reason and I can't see throwing my money away again.
