With so many good taquerias in town it only makes sense to go to the ones that are consistently good and this one just isn't.
author: Rabbit B.

description:
I've driven by this place many times, and always wanted to try it out.  Was doing some errands last week nearby and stopped by for lunch.  Tried the tacos.  Got a beef and a pork crunchy tacos.  Overall, I thought they were over-priced and underwhelming.  The tacos were stuffed with meat - which saved it from a 1 star rating - but the meat was dry and bland.

I have not tried the other menu items, but based on the tacos I would say that the two burrito/taco/etc. places on Divisidero between Pine and Bush are much better tasting and better priced.
author: Boomer D.

description: Great place. Get the barracho and you will be quite happy! Their regular burritos are average but the burracho is amazing. Tacos are good too. Awesome salsa as well. It's really the only quality mexican place in the richmond (Gordos is terrible).
author: Andrew M.

description:
I live a few blocks away and probably hit Pancho's once every week or two.  I wish the buritos were bigger and tastier.  But they have a little salsa bar that you can load up on to spice things up.  The standouts are the tortilla soup - made from scratch and very tasty, and the tacos (tortias are made to order!) also tasty but tiny.  Service is very slow.  If you see a line of two or three people, prepare to wait.  I think it is because they work a lot of phone in take out orders.  If I'm in my car I'll roll down Geary to 18th Ave and go to Gordo's instead for tastier eats.

Originally I gave two stars but upped it to three after rethinking my experience here, which has usually been very good.
author: John S.

description:
Love the Borracho Burrito!!  It's yummy and not too spicy.  My kids enjoy the colorful chips and cheese quesadillas.

Pleasant staff and relaxed environment.  Pancho's is a family favorite!
author: Christina B.

description:
Always great for laid back Sunday afternoon.  I love this place!  I usually have the nachos or the veggie buritto, but the portions are huge so bring a friend.  

Four stars because sometimes the music can be too loud and that makes me really anxious when I am eating...I'm not trying to break a record here.
author: Riri S.

description:
the burritos are mini chipotle franchise tasting.  they include great fresh chips with every order and they have a phenomenal serve yourself salsa bar.  great tasting, and with lots of choices and veggies, as opposed to gordo's.  they have sopas and horchata so, yeah.
thanks for reading.
author: yayoi s.

description: Good place that I can walk to from home doesn't beat Gordo's or places over in the mission but next best thing, if you don't live in the area nothing to go out of your way for.  Dont' forget to tell them what beans you like also they never ask and I always end up with pinto instead of black beans which I prefer.  Also if your really into good chips they are weak (hate chips break super easy need some thick crunchy ones) I've only tried burritos and tacos I like everything except not that into the fajita burritos personally
author: Nirea S.

description: I come here for Mexican food often. The food is really good, as Mexican food is my weakness. $8 is somewhat expensive for a burrito.
author: Scott W.

description: Pleasantly surprised! Steak nachos were devoured within minutes!
author: Nina P.

description:
The only place that's ever given me food poisoning in my entire life. 

Seriously. 

It was bad enough to pay $12 for a burrito mojado, chips, and beer when I could've had the same (and better quality) for $6 in the Mission, but the volcanic ass-blast & bazooka-barfing that followed was horrific and had my wife wondering if I was gonna survive. Never again.
author: Ronzlo L.

description: good, local joint with mostly friendly folks. I go there way too often but its always good. Get the #1: chicken tacos with guacamole, rice, & beans. woof! I'm stuck on that right now. used to be chicken quesadilla's. My friend gets the Baracho Burrito: huge and full of good things. And get the spicy red sauce! I suppose its not the MIssion but that ain't always a bad thing.
author: Richard A.

description: I've been remiss in writing many reviews recently. However, once I had a Pancho's Super Carnitas Burrito - my first thought was to sign in and let other Yelpers know to head the other direction down to Gordo's on Clement for cheaper and better food. The burrito was bland. No flavor or taste. One star for doing quite a disservice to carnitas.
author: Jenny T.

description: Well, its not the greatest and not the worst. The only great things here for me to vouch for are the crunchy crisp chips and the gaucamole. I kind of have to agree sadly that the burrito's do taste somewhat watered down. But I give it 3 stars because service is quick and they have a nice decor. But I must say that they are certainly improving in the way they make their burritos. So much hope is not lost. We'll see how they are in a year.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
My boyfriend and I are big Gordo fans but thought we'd try Pancho's just once. That was all it took; the burritos we got had so much cheese I could taste little else (and what was there wasn't that fantastic otherwise) and he and I both spent the rest of the night violently ill. I imagine that's not a typical experience so I can't blame the illness on them entirely (though I know it was the burrito) but will never go again. We thought it was so bad that it's now a running joke between the two of us whenever we go past!

If you want a great burrito at a good price, hop on the 38 and go out to 19th/Geary and get one from Gordo's. I have yet to get a bad burrito from them and the service is fast too.
author: Rachael E.

description:
This place is great with healthy Mexican food.  The taco plate is delicious with a perfect combination of freshly made tortillas, perfectly spiced chicken (or whatever meat you like), guac and salsa.  Of course you can add your favorite salsa from the salsa bar.  

I also love the big bowl of chicken soup for those cold days when some comfort is necessary.  This is a great casual, inexpensive place to eat!
author: Carol M.

description:
So after me and my roommate got our nails done today, we were starving, and stumbled upon this place. From the outside, it didn't look that inviting, but as I said, we were starving. Upon entering though, my mind was completely changed.
The decor was great, very homey feeling. Very lively music. Small, but comfortable at the same time. The service was super fast, my food was ready practically right after I ordered it. They don't have waiters though, it's the kind of place where they call your number and you pick it up at the counter.
I got a steak fajita burrito, which was AMAZING. Perfect, huge, and wayyy better than I expected. Also, they serve it to you with chips, which were great & tasted homemade, and you can pick your salsa from a bunch of choices (the three I tried were all very good). They also serve glass bottles of coke, which is a huge plus for me, and went great with my burrito.
Overall, I can definitely see myself coming back here A LOT, as it's right down the block from my house and sooo tasty, and I'm gonna tell everyone I know about it too.
author: Erika B.

description:
i really really hate talking smack about places that i frequent regularly. it makes me feel like a dirty, no-good traiter. and yet....

i wouldn't go to pancho's if there were any other place to get mexican food withing walking distance of my office. i love burritos, don't get me wrong, but i have more than once thrown out a pancho's burrito after a few bites because i simply could not deal with having pieces of it in my mouth any more. the typical vegan burrito is a simple thing: beans, rice, pico, guac, lettuce. i really don't like the (lack of?) flavor of the beans and rice here, and the guac is bland--needs salt and lime. the burritos i've gotten have also been quite juicy, not in the succulent, luscious, delectable way, but in the bean and iceberg lettuce water way. 

i also often, on a hungover lunch, simply order some heated flour tortillas with some sides of guac. this is one of my favorite hungover snacks, but again, the only reason i get it here is because there's no where else in walking distance to go and sometimes i just need that shit. it's...fine. it'll do. 

one full star for really nice cashiers, though. they are always super duper friendly with me, even when i'm....well, even when i'm deathly hungover and ordering one tortilla and one side of guac, with special instructions to please heat up the tortilla,not even the hint of a smile on my dehydrated, underslept face, and trying to pay with my card for a purchase of less that $3. 

i'm sorry for betraying you, panchos. please forgive me. and then start making better burritos just to show me up.
author: Devin F.

description: 20 minutes for a burrito? Really. Don't waste your time or money.
author: Scott J.

description:
used to frequent the other panchos on polk for the sopa de pollo, which i adore for it's chunky veggies and lean chix. after moving, i came here for what i expected to be the same chicken soup. WRONG. this location's version had hardly any vegetables. one slice of carrot. ONE. no potatoes, no celery, very little rice. it was chicken broth and some chicken. they didn't even put a  slice of lime on the side. it was so insulting. and salty.

i was, however, gratified to see that they had the same photo of julio iglesias on the wall... i gave them an extra star for that.
author: SM A.

description:
I don't know what these people are talking about!?!?!? This is a pretty decent place to eat mexican food. It is a fast food type yet cozy inside..
I would recommend this place to check it out..
author: Sophie C.

description: I LOVE my local taqueria!! They are fast, and always super-friendly. If I'm really hungry, I'll do the steak barracho burrito. On a lighter night, I will do the sopa de pollo which is fan-fricking-tastic!!
author: Michelle D.

description:
Went here last night and ordered what I always get at a taqueria which is a regular carne asada burrito. I don't need it all confused with cheese, sour cream and lettuce (seriously  who puts lettuce in a burrito). First downfall was they charged me the same price as one with all the fixings which brought the bill to $7 for a regular burrito ! Yikes.

The line was going out the door and moved super slow which was annoying. It must have been the driest burrito ever, it just sat clogged in my upper gut for ages before it digested, meat was dry and no seasoning could be detected anywhere. Talk about bland and boring. The salsas were lame, the hot one was salty but the chips were good.

This burrito would have been good for slapping someone upside the head and that's about the only use it would be worthy of. 
It seems that west of stanyan street that a decent burrito cannot be found.
author: J l.

description: This is a great little neighborhood hole-in-the-wall taqueria.  It can take a little while to get your food when they are busy, but that's because they're making everything fresh as they go.  The staff is usually friendly.  Their sopa de pollo is a nice, healthy option, but I'd say get a fajita burrito which comes with a side of chips and salsa.  It's one of the best burritos in town!  I rank it above Papalote.
author: Amy S.

description: great food. i ordered the chicken burrito and it taste like authentic mexican food. they should give free refills on horchatas. overall great food
author: Sunil K.

description: Pancho's is not the best Mexican ever, but it's good standard burritos and tacos.  Their chicken soup is one of their best menu items - really fresh, delicious combo of flavors, including a generous serving of avocado.  It's a little pricier than the Mission taquerias, but north side real estate is more expensive than Mission real estate - what are you going to do?  We call for take out orders all the time - they're fast, and you get a bag of tortilla chips with your burrito.  Great way to feed the kids on a Friday night.
author: Nancy S.

description:
/ummm, soo sad to see that they barely make 3 stars- where have you all been eating???

I live literally down the block and this wonderful place has (quite expensively) become the place I call when I've had a great day, an awful day, or a tiring day. Which somehow ends up happening at least, if not more than, once a week. They do exactly what I want and offer such fresh and perfectly salted tortilla chips. Sometimes, I even walk in here just for the chips. 

Pancho's, I love you. Thank you for being 6 houses down and always open :)
author: mariela p.

description:
I really wish this place would invest in a star splitter so we can get a half star into the rating system. This is one of those times that I wish they had the star splitter. I want to give them 3.5 stars and not 4. Oh, well. What can you do?

So I needed some food and I also needed money. I find myself trekking through the thick fog that just rolled in and the light drizzle that was accompanying it. Finally made it to the atm machine and got my cash. Then I proceeded to walk back up Geary. Saw Pancho and walked in. Now, I was tired and hungry. I was thinking get a burrito and eat it on the way back. So I ordered the Atomic one with the hot sauce and stuff. When I sat down, I looked over at the guy that was making my burrito and noticed him putting it on a plate. I was wondering is that mine? So I glanced over at the menu and saw that my burrito is a wet burrito. GOD DAMN IT!!! I never really liked wet burritos because they never seem to taste right. Call me crazy but the sauce is almost always weird on the wet burritos I have ordered in the past for some reason. So I looked on, not wanting to change the order and just sucking it up and manning up to the order snafu I made.

So I pick up my order and walked back to Family's Billiards and ate my WET burrito outside on the bench they had for the smokers. I was pleasantly surprised. The sauce didn't taste like shit and it didn't over power the burrito. And the spice was nice and warm. Not too hot but not too weak where you have to find the heat. I liked it and that says a lot of the burrito. Especially when it's a wet one. 

So I finished the whole thing...Hey! I was hungry! Didn't care too much for the chips. Not sure if they make their own or not but today they broke out the red and blue chips for the Fourth of July. Yeah, bag shit you get from Safeway. Next time I will try something that isn't in the wet category so I can judge their burritos against others that I have had. It's not fair to compare a wet to a dry. So if you want a wet one, try this place. Not bad at all.
author: Anthony L.

description:
if you only have $20 in your pocket and you left your credit/ATM card at home and you have a companion who doesn't have cash or credit card, this is a favorable, commendable taqueria to have a satisfying dinner.

i had my first experience of a burrito that has BBQ sauce incorporated in it!! and it was given the name: THE BORRACHO!!! it was really splendid wrapped in a nice CHILE TORTILLA. the GRILLED CHICKEN FAJITA BURRITO that i opted to be wrapped in a pleasant WHEAT TORTILLA was a little bit salty and quite greasy. to balance the flavor, i loaded it with their mild salsa, which turned out kosher!!

i also noticed that this place could get really busy, especially for take-out orders.
author: Nelle A.

description: Lately I've been the type of guy that likes to get burned with spicy dishes.  That led me to order the Atomic-Shrimp Burrito and a chicken nachos for my first visit to Pancho's.  I brought the goods over to Underdog to watch a game with friends.  I was utterly disappointed with the soggy mess that was inside.  The atomic stood for the amount of let down you would get and the nachos couldn't even hold it's own to Underdog's Nachos that night.  Flavors were off and spicy wasn't included in the order even though I requested extra hot.  With the hundreds of quality Mexican Restaurants we have in the city, a return visit will never happen.
author: Jason A.

description: This place is making me re-think my previously tough stance on immigration.  Every dining experience I have had at Pancho's has been great.  The staff is friendly, and the food is quite good.  I typically get the Fajita Burrito with either steak or chicken.  The guac deserves a mention as well.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because of their Salsa.  Their mild and medium are satisfactory, but the hot is not very good.  I am afraid that Pancho's has made the mistake that so many SF Mexican restaurants seem to make:  they give thier hot salsa a smoky flavor.  Despite this one small flaw, Pancho's is great.
author: Mr. Papshmir ..

description: Service is friendly at both places and they're generous with their chips (which are tasty), but I prefer the location on Polk--besides being near my home, they don't mess up my order.  Unfortunately, there's not a whole lot of choices for Mexican food in the area.  Fill up here before catching a flick at the Bridge.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Good, if not AY DIOS MIO MUY FANTASTICO. There's never a long wait, the decor is pretty funny, and the food's pretty consistently good, esp. anything with the word 'Fajita' in the title. My only main gripe is theres not too much variety. Not exactly a date place, more of an upgrade from USF cafeteria mexican food if you're in the mood to spend the extra cash. Also much less expensive than Mel's across the street. Viva la Salsa bar!
author: Andrew B.

description: I live down the street so it's nice to have something close when I need a Mexican fix.  Decent tacos and chips.  Chicken soup is ok, especially when you're sick.   Best part: watching them make the corn tortillas and throw them on the griddle.
author: Andrea R.

description:
I'm writing this review only because I couldn't believe my eyes when some dude wrote, "If Taco Bell were on this block, Pancho's wouldn't even get 1 star..."

That's just crazy talk.

I've been going here for nearly 8 years (it's better than the one on Polk St., which has definitely screwed up my takeout order on more than one occasion), and it is my favorite in the city because 1) it has the best steak-and-shrimp burrito I've ever had, 2) it has the best-tasting guacamole I've ever had, and 3) they don't put green peas or carrots in their seasoned rice.

A few months ago, I asked one of the guys behind the counter what they put in their gauc. He reeled off the list of ingredients for me, and my wife and I have been able to reproduce their guac formula at home on numerous occasions ever since. Amazing stuff.

I'm pretty damn picky, and my idea of great Mexican food may not be up to par with the more authentic options in the Mission. I would like to give this place 5 stars but out of respect for those who might laugh at the notion of getting truly great/authentic Mexican food in the Inner Richmond, I'll give it four.

But to even mention this place in the same sentence as Taco Bell is moronic, unless one says that "this place is in a completely different league than a lousy Taco Bell".

Happy Cinco de Mayo!
author: B. Earl K.

description: I used to come to Pancho's fairly regularly when I was in grad school at USF.  The food is nothing to write home about, but it's decent.  It's also a little bit pricy for what it is.  If you're in the neighborhood and don't feel like walking up and over the hill to get to the Haight, you could do worse than this place.
author: John S.

description: The menu makes it so easy when I am ordering. OMG and there are different types of tortillas! SPINACH and TOMATO but I do not think that those are the freshest they can be. The combo's are very worth it since you get a baby burrito, chips, guacamole, and a cheese quesadilla. The guac is very good!! I love burritos with grilled chicken!
author: Janet Z.

description: They get it done & they can make a white girl burrito. If you want authentic, just go to the Mission, ya whiner!
author: Melisser E.

description:
I prefer Gordos, but there's never any parking at the 3 locations....

This place isn't so bad except it's a long wait for a burrito or taco....

Fish tacos are tasty...
author: L w.

description: I've eaten a lot of burritos from this place and it should probably only have 3-stars but I've really never had a bad experience here and that's good since most of the other places that are convenient for me have messed up at some point or another.
author: Ryan P.

description: I go to Pancho's almost once a week, as it's walking distance from work.  The staff is real friendly and the service is usually pretty quick.  I've gone there so much I can say I've tried almost everything on their menu.  My favorite remain the carnitas anything (burrito, nachos, tacos).  Try their chicken soup..it's loaded with all this goodness from cut up corn on the cob to rice and avocado.  It's not the best burrito out there, but they get extra points for their light and crispy chips and salsa bar.
author: Marie B.

description: I too am all about Gordo's. As I live only one block from the Geary location, it's our stand by. But, when laziness can be averted, Pancho's it is! Salsa bar alone is worth the visit.
author: Natas N.

description: Burritos are very good! The service is fast and friendly and the tortillas are thin and savory.  The tortillas soup is a good value--you get a lot of tasty soup for not too much $$.
author: Britany F.

description:
This taqueria has great ambience- it is clean, well lit, the menu board easy to read, friendly people at the register, etc. We came in here for a late to-go dinner one night and it was satisfying. The burritos were a little lumpy for my liking but I really like how they added broccolli and peppers to a Veggie Burrito which at most places is just a regular burrito without meat. It was nice to see they added something different that tastes great. 
Although I do recommend this place simply because it is probably the one and only good place to eat quick Mexican fast food on Geary Blvd- DO NOT TRY THE HOT RED SALSA- it tastes like tar. The Green Salsa is alot and if you didn't order a spicy burrito and don't like bland tasting food be prepared to add alot of it.
Overall, for a quick bite it was good. I will go back if I'm ever stranded in this area again while craving Mexican and I do recommend to those who live around the area and aren't willing to travel down to the Mission for a good burrito. 
It's satisfying as a quick fix.
author: Sia P.

description: this is based on one experience. got a burrito & tacos to go.  seriously, the most bland, boring, poorly assembled, cold, flat out worst taqueria food i've ever had in 12 years in SF.  it's my neighborhood taqueria and I will never give it another chance.  such a bummer.
author: Chad W.

description:
I have been going to this Pancho's since it was opened.  What about 10 or so years ago? Damn the years are flying by.  I go here because there are NO other Mexican restaurants in the Inner Richmond and Gordo's is not worth going twenty blocks for.  

The food at Pancho's is decent but not spectacular.  I get the mahi mahi tacos or the baracho burrito most of the time.  The portions are little small for the money, I never feel all the way full afterward. The meat is lean and gringo-friendly.  The salsa bar is pretty good. 

Oh yeah, I almost forgot that I resent how much room they give the kitchen because they don't have enough tables and the ones they do have are all crammed together.
author: Swaz E.

description:
I moved around the corner from Pancho's a couple months ago from San Diego and have been there a few times since. I'm a bit of a snob when it comes to Mexican food, having been spoiled for most of my college life, but was pleasantly surprised by this place.

Granted, I haven't been to that many places in the city, so hopefully they are all as good as this place. Great tacos and nachos, which are what I have been getting recently. I've had the shrimp quesadilla and carne asada burrito, both of which were good but not great. 

Like most people have said the chips are amazing, but the salsa bar is a bit lacking. The mild is mostly onions and without that much flavor, and the medium is a little runny. The hot is probably the way to go if you like it like that. 

Pretty good prices and the service has always been nice, so it will keep me coming back. Check it out for the chips and tacos at least.
author: Jeffrey V.

description: Loving burritos & living around the corner, I gave Pancho's 3 times before making an opinion.  The first 2 times, I was completely unimpressed - greasy burritos without much flavor.  But, then I learned the secret... the BBQ Chicken (Borracho) burrito is the standout on the menu & the one that keeps people coming back.
author: Ken H.

description: This place rocks. This place has great chicken or grilled steak fajitas. Free unlimited chips if you eat there! On top of great food, the owner is really nice and fun to talk to. The average meal is about 6-7 bucks which is touching the pricy side.
author: Brian W.

description: I eat here pretty regular the portions are great the pork is tender the atomic burrito is my favorite that and a beer will cost about 12 bucks but you wont be able to move after you finish it good salsa (medium and tomatillo and the really hot one) its close to my house and when i need a mexican fix it is always there for me haha
author: C. M.

description: SO MUCH BETTER THAN GORDO'S. This place has some pretty solid burritos/nachos/tacos, everything is really good. Also, the salsa bar is legendary - really, really good pico de gallo (no joke - i eat it like salad when I go there). Delivery and take out... great!
author: Samantha W.

description: I waited 20 minutes for an unacceptably bland burrito, seeing only one other person get their burrito during that entire 20 minute period. Panchos has one of most inefficient, seasoning deficient kitchens in the entire city.
author: Andrea S.

description: The only reason I come here is for their chicken burracho.  Yes, I'm well aware that this isn't authentic Mexican food, but does it matter if it tastes good?  They wrap you a heavy, brick-size burrito in a corn skin AND there's BBQ sauce.  And really, what doesn't taste good with BBQ sauce?
author: Kim K.

description: I love this place. Although I'm sure there are fantabulous burritos to be found in the Mission, those of us who live in these parts of the city also need good Mexican! The only other burrito place that I think is this good is a little place in Civic Center that I go to for lunch sometimes. Try the carnitas! At some point I want to try the Sopa de pollo, which sounds and looks delish!
author: Amy B.

description: I think that they have a fresh low-grease high flavor style. This is indeed a distinctive taste that beats the bland watery starch cigar that is Gordos
author: Ris M.

description:
It's so hopeless. I try and I try and I try to be a healthy person. But every time I make it to the gym, have a great, invigorating, sweaty workout, I don't think, "hey, I want to go home and eat some tofu and sprouts!" I think, "hey, doesn't a burrito sound swell right now?"

It was such a night that I found myself in Pancho's for lack of a better option for satisfying my burrito craving. FYI, the inner Richmond doesn't have much to offer in the way of Mexican. If you're not heading all the way out to Tommy's or Tia Margaritas, then you might as well just go get some Thai food or something. But I'd never been to Pancho's and I thought I should give it a shot and it was most conveniently located to the bar in which I was due to meet the BF for a beer. 

Anyway, I got the Borracho, the one with the BBQ sauce on it, because you could put BBQ sauce on almost anything and it will be pretty good. Plus I liked the name. Let's just say, the burrito was satisfying. It hit the burrito spot. But was it a truly fine and estimable burrito? Not really. It was adequate. And if the craving struck again and Pancho's was the only place around, well, sure, I'd go back. 

But maybe I'm jaded. 15 years as an SF resident will put your burrito standards at all-time unattainable sky high. I remember when Puerto Allegre had the best burritos around. El Farlito is still up there, but not what it once was. Same with La Cumbre. I am constantly nostalgic for Chabela's, though I do know they did decline in quality in the years before they burned down. Balazo is very shiny, but the burritos are hit and miss at best. 

Anyway, I'm haven't had one of those perfect burritos, the hot and gooey ones with the sturdy yet supple tortilla and the perfect proportions of filling and the right amount of cheese and the correct level of spiciness in forever. If anyone can point me in the right direction, I'm all ears.
author: Sage R.

description: I've read some of the other reviews and I am glad I tried this place before reading them because I have had nothing but good experiences at Pancho's. My brother and I have been twice and have tried a few burritos and have been completely satisfied. The burritos are big which is nice because it fills you up and I don't really think it was very expensive for the amount of food I received. The tortillas are good which is sometimes not the case in Nor Cal Mexican food restaurants (I'm from San Diego so I'm used to the good stuff.) If you eat in the restaurant the beer selection is good and cheap which is a plus and I love when places give you chips with your food (this does not happen much down south). So I like Pancho's a lot, my brother loves the vegetables in the veggie burrito (it is a random selection yet surprisingly good together) and it is close to my house which is a HUGE plus!
author: Amber E.

description: Wow, this place is not good.  I've dined here twice with friends who for some reason like this joint.  I have to put in another plug for El Tonayense Tack Trucks because they blow this place outta the water.  The burritos are bland and it just doesn't taste like real Mexican food.  Not sure what else to say.
author: Christopher W.

description: LOL - I can't believe this place has a 5 star rating.  For knock off, regret it the next morning, fast mexcian food, this place is great.  If you want some quality and definately more authentic options, go down geary to Tommy's or up to Balazo on Haight.
author: Jared F.

description: Really spicey sauces for dipping.  Good selection of cold beers.  Yummy fish tacos.  Not the best, but close and definately hit the spot.
author: Mary R.

description: Let's be honest, we're not talking about gourmet mexican food here.  But, when I want some fast, decent mexican, Panchos does the trick for me.  It's only two blocks from home, making it the easy choice for me.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but I do thoroughly enjoy the chicken quesadilla with corn tortilla (*must* get with corn tortilla).  I cover it in Cholula sauce. mmmmmm.  I also enjoy the nachos with chicken or just vegetarian.  Very filling.  Good times.
author: Angie C.

description: Good chicken soup.  I'm not a big fan of their burritos.
author: Andrew R.

description: The average rating of this spot is about right.  If multi-colored chips and mediocre meals are your thing, then please, give this place a try.   Diluted.
author: andrew l.

description: I have to admit...I have only tried the chicken soup...but I came back two more times just for it....I really liked it..especially during all the cold rain....and they put sliced alvacado's on top....and a warm tortilla....I may just go tomorrow too! Now I am craving it.
author: Nancy P.

description: My fiance and I went here after a long day and had a pretty good experience.  We had a very friendly server who was very helpful.  I ordered the grilled chicken fajita burrito and she ordered the chicken tacos.  Both we just ok, but I do like the offering of fajita style which other burrito places do not offer in the city(i.e. - Gordo's).  We also had Guacamole and chips which were the highlight.  The chips were thin and crispy and the guac was pretty good(little too much onion in my opinion).  Overall it was quick and pretty tasty mexican food.  Another plus that we found out is that they are open late all week, which is key for us because we live in the richmond and there aren't many places open late for decent food.
author: Alex E.

description: I don't get it.... This place has some of the best chips in the city.  But the burrito's are profoundly bland.  Absolutely no flavor.  How can a place that puts such effort into having great chips (when at most burrito places the chips are second rate) be so bad with their burrito's??????
author: p w.

description: Decent Mexican for your money. Lots of differnt kinds of salsa which Im a fan of. Its a nice change in the IR when you feel like you're surrounded by DimSum and sushi 24/7.
author: Erin F.

description: Okay, fine, no it's not authentic.  But, their food is good.  I've been going to this neighborhood place for years and their burritos are always the same,  hot, fresh ingredients and not greasy or heavy.  The self serve salsa bar it is great.
author: Ronnie T.

description: Compared to other taqueria's in the city, this place is in the bottom quarter of all of them. The nachos aren't that bad. The chips used for the nachos were ok, nothing more than that., but one thing I did enjoy was the guacamole.  There were actual chunks of avocado in the guacamole!!!! That is always a plus, also having some in my very bland chicken fajita burrito added a little taste along with the salsa I added. If you want a burrito go to the mission, definitely worth it.
author: D J.

description: I only seem to come here on Sundays.  My go-to place "El Burrito Express #2" isn't open on Sunday.  I always get the same thing, the Boracho Burrito.  It's a sweet BBQ sauce burrito that is a nice change up from your everyday burrito.  It's tasty, but I don't go away feeling full.  The chips and salsa bar are great.
author: Rob U.

description: If you grew up on Baja Fresh, La Salsa and Rubios (before Rubios got nasty) like myself, then you can appreciate Pancho's.  Its not a "hangover cure burrito" place as I like to call 'em (ie: Gordo's, Ocean Taq) but it is fresh and it won't make you feel like you wanna roll over and pass out after you take that last bite.
author: Aimee F.

description: I was hoping that the atomic burrito would be exploding w/ flavor, but I was let down.  The red sauce was watery and lack luster.   They have an okay salsa bar is okay, hence the word okay.  Many better options in the mission.  I have had their tacos, which were good, but again, not to die for.
author: Nicole F.

description: I am from Arizona so I have a high standard with Mexican food.  This place is good, but I am sure there are better places out there.  Reasonably priced
author: Jennifer A.

description:
2 stars based on merit. Unfortunately, due to proximity, I'm sure I'll be back. Only taqueria in walking distance and all. Too bad. I was especially excited when I saw it was Baja-style. To me that means good salsas and pico de gallo, great fish tacos, and exceptional chicken tortilla soup. The salsa wasn't bad, I admit, and I didn't try the fish taco. But I was sooo excited to try the chicken soup, but it was horribly disappointing and utterly flavorless. And colorless. And overall blah blah blah. Nothing Baja, or even remotely Mexican about it. It was just undercooked veggies, boring boiled chicken, and blech rice in watery nothing broth. Hardly even soup! The nachos were decent and entirely edible, if nothing special, so at least that will always be an option. The burrito was passable, but COME ON. This is San Francisco. When it comes to burritos, and taquerias in general, what is passable elsewhere is simply laughable here. Since I'll be back, I'll just keep trying different items and report back if I find anything 

Even Baja Fresh is better, and it's a national chain. At least their chicken soup has flavor.

****
Update: If willing to walk just a few blocks more to Haight, Zona Rosa is far superior in the taqueria category.
author: Veronica L.

description: My experience at Panchos has been noing short of awesome! The combination of burritos and their salsa verde is the best way to go. The ambience leaves something to be desired but the food makes up for it. Watch your head if you use the facilities.
author: Ryan M.

description: Okay, so the only reason I eat at Pancho's is because the Mission is not within walking distance of my apartment. Pancho's serves a decent burrito and their chips and salsa are good too. The food has more of a California flare to it. It's not overly expensive for what you get considering it's pretty much the only option when you're living in Inner Richmond...
author: Queenie C.

description:
been here a few times because of it's convenient proximity to campus.

burritos, tacos are decent. (burritos at gordo's are far superior in taste and size) the posole (corn tortilla soup) is pretty good. i wish the salsas were more flavorful though. i tend to judge a mexican restuarant by their salsas and the salsas here tend to be on the bland side.

i also feel like i overpay sometimes here im not sure why. taste is a little bit miss on everything.

they have yummy refreshing watermelon juice though that's a must-try! :)
author: Amanda N.

description: The Borracho steak Burrito is amazing, and their hot salsa is the only salsa I've had in the Bay Area that challenges me (although it's gotten a bit milder lately).
author: Devin V.

description: I wish this place was good, because it's realllly close to my house. But the rice in my burrito was dry and flavorless, the chicken was cold, and the beans had a very odd texture reminiscent of packing peanuts. If you want barely-warm or cold burritos with pretty much no flavor at all, then this is your best bet.
author: Ryan L.

description: We ordered a group take out over the phone and it was done quick style.  Which was great.  It wasn't great or to die for, but it's cheap and good.  Definitely worth what you pay for. I'm a huge guacamole fan and theirs wasn't anything special.
author: Rei and Rick ..

description: When I'm in the mood for something that's close and easy, I sometimes head down to Pancho's. I have tried to give this place a chance. I really have. I keep thinking "maybe this time it will be better"...but 4/5 times it's just the same. Dry, overcooked meat, disinterested staff and dirty tables. But every now and then, I get their mini burrito to go, and it hits the spot. I guess it's mostly laziness that keeps bringing me back. Oh well.
author: Manisha M.

description:
Moving from Texas, I think this city's Mexican food really sucks. The suckage falls into two categories: dirty/bland Mission and overpriced everywhere else.

Panchos manages to avoid falling into either of these categories. For some reason I like this place. Maybe they've won my loyalty because it's an easy stop on the way home. Maybe I've only been there on the clean days. Maybe I just like really good salsa (Panchos has it). Who really knows? 

But I don't hate this place. In fact, I think it's above the average for this city. And above an above average burrito will always earn a 4 in my book.
author: B H.

description: They have one of my favourite hot salsa. Pretty decent place, nice place and quick service and plus amazing grilled chicken burrito. i would definately recommend this place.
author: Nick A.

description: This place gets 4 stars in my book for having whole wheat tortillas, grilling the burritos, and being a place that is open late in the Inner Richmond that isn't Jack in the Box or Mr. Pizza Man.
author: Celeste L.

description: This place sucks and it only took a number of times to keep going back for me to finally admit that.  I get an upset stomach whenever I go there.  The tortilla chips are always stale.  I never liked their burritos so I started ordering their soft tacos.  The portion sizes aren't that great and the corn tortillas have that suspicious flavor of lard.  I'll save my money and use a little gas next time & drive to the mission for good mexican food.
author: Pisces B.

description: The chicken Borracho burrito is da bomb. Yep, I used the words, "da bomb". The ratio of grease to food is perfect and I don't feel so guilty when I eat a big fat burrito -- unlike hitting up the Taquerias.
author: Chris G.

description: Good salsas and quality ingredients. I like that there are always two salsas that have tomatillos and just enough kick. I like my burrito simple and they don't disappoint. Their guacamole is great too.
author: Dre D.

description: Their burritos quality has been going down consistently. They used to put a lot of food in - now theres hardly anything that they put in.
author: Glenn I.

description: People say this place is good but I've tried this place 2-3 times and I just dont like their burritos. Go to Gordos instead.
author: Roger C.

description: The combo number 1 is the one to have. Bottomless salsa cups are cool. Steak & chicken tacos are great. I live near the mission so I get enough good Mex, but this place was a welcome surprise in the Richmond.
author: Jet V.

description: I live extremely close to this place. So of course I had to try it... the guac/salsa/chips is amazing. Everything else was just eh.
author: Jen C.

description: Nothing wrong with this place at all.  I had their steak burrito with a nice Dos Equis cerveza.  Very inexpensive and quick service.  Their chips were nice as was their salsa.
author: Anthony L.

description: Meh,.. ok food. Not impressive, but will do if you are on foot and don't have a lot of time for a long meal.
author: Kantancerous I.

description: I went here several times and was generally pleased with the food. However, one time my boyfriend discovered a dead bug in the bottom of his burrito and that was enough to turn both of us off forever. I've been going to several Mexican places for a while and have never experienced anything like that, but the third time that we visited Pancho's, this happened. Bad news if you ask me. Try Chino's instead.
author: Tatiana T.

description: My most favorite taqueria in the entire bay area. their salsa and chips are probably the best thing, but everything else on the menu is fabulous as well. Good staff, fast service, good music.... Never had a disappointing visit.
author: Benjamin K.

description:
meh. pancho's is mediocre at best. i justify these two stars because my last burrito here was bipolar. that is, half was hot with meat and the other cold with salsa and unmelted cheese. not cool. sucks because the closest taqueria by my house is this one. whatever, i'll just go to gordo's instead. at least they have quesadilla suizas..

quesadilla suizas  quesadilla suizas  quesadilla suizas  quesadilla suizas  quesadilla suizas  quesadilla suizas  quesadilla suizas  quesadilla suizas  quesadilla suizas  quesadilla suizas  quesadilla suizas  !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: alex c.

description: The food here is selectively good. The chips are spectacular, thusly the nachos are as well (and come in a huge portion to boot), the pico de gallo is excellent, baja fish tacos aren't bad. I was unimpressed by the atomic burrito. It's a bit pricey for the quality of Mexican food, but where else are you going to go to kill a taco craving in the Richmond?
author: Preston G.

description: Great food and I love the chips, which is why I am a repeat customer.  I do feel like I get oggled a little, which can be uncomfortable.  Heck, maybe I should just take the compliment - I only have about 5 years of cute left.
author: Ann S.

description: I live right next to Pancho's and it's only reserved for nights I missed dinner or early nights home from the bar and even starving or with the aid of a good buzz Pancho's is Taco Bell's rich cousin at best and ethnic mush at worst. I don't know how they manage to make Mexican food so unappealing but every time I go it reminds me of why I waited however long to return.
author: Daniel S.

description: tosada salad can't be beat in SF. line is long for lunch. great salsa. efficient staff. not 5 stars because food temperature can be not up to par sometimes.
author: Eloy T.

description: This place walks a sad middle ground of not being particularly good and not being particularity cheep, but it's still the best taco place I've found within a 10 block radius.
author: rory l.

description: cheap beer good food. the 'boracho' is a good meal. pork tacos are nice as well.
author: aidan m.

description: The decor of the place is perfect: Salsa bar, to-go counter, all Mexican staff with a burrito making station, Mexican horns blaring through fuzzy speakers.  Now to the food:  Absolutely $&"#% disgusting.  I ordered a simple fast-food Mexi staple: carne asada burrito with rice, beans, sour cream and salsa.  The meat was in long stringy chunks as if it had been chewed before, the rice and beans were tasteless and it was topped off with a huge golf ball of sour cream.  Salsa is the best way to judge the quality of a Mexi burrito shop and their salsa was spot on:  Absolute crap.  Stinging red salsa as if mixed with turpentine, tasteless salsa verde and a strange light brown salsa with enough flavor to mask the soul-less burrito.  This is my first post, Is there any way to get enough negative ratings and get a place shut down?  If there's a yelp petition app for the iphone, sign me up.  Little chihuahua is much better as well as any burrito shop in San Diego.   Shame on you Pancho.
author: Stephen L.

description: the only thing i really like there is the Pico De gallo salsa.... it has the most flavor then the whole meal.... I ate the tacos there and it's just "eh"..... OK.... meat had good flavor but not the beans and rice... sorta bland.... sorry for those who really like it there, but i've had much better mexican food then this....
author: E S.

description: I really like Pancho's, it may not be as good as a Mission taqueria, but I love their veggie burrito with grilled veggies. I also love the decor, and the people who work there are really friendly. Everything I've had has always been yummy and fresh. My babe loves the veggie tacos.
author: Penny S.

description: this is the place where i had my first burrito. it was good and they have really good salsa. i would definitely recommend the chicken burrito and torta. i didn't notice before but they have crispy lettuce in their burritos. they also open until 11 pm and i think it's the only burrito place out there that takes credit cards.
author: Lynn P.

description: Given there is no Mexican eatery in the inner Richmond, Pancho's does okay in satisfying my once-in-a-while cravings for Mexican foods.  I usually order the veggie burrito ($6.95) which is pretty packed with veggies instead of mostly carbs.  Tortilla chips come along with the order.  These little treats are just to my liking, thin and crispy with a salsa bar made readily available to you for self service.  I usually pack on extra cilantro-onion salsa to accompany my veggie burrito.  Craving satisfied!
author: Nadine M.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! although the mission is THE place to get mexican, this is my favorite spot near me. MUCH better and more traditional than Papalote which is down the street. the carnitas tacos here are the best i've had in the city so far! their taquitos dorados are so crunchy on the outside yet juicy and tender on the inside. and they pile on the guacamole!!! this place (unlike most mexican restaurants) does not skimp on the guacamole. their borracho burrito is sooo yummy! and for the burritos you can choose between a regular flour, wheat, or veggie tortilla! the white corn tortillas they use for the tacos are really soft and i believe they're handmade. and they recently extended their hours so now they're open later!
author: N. M.

description: This city is about having any craving satisfied and when it's Mexican in my hood, I go here. It's clean, food is fresh and it's not authentic by any means but I prefer that fusion anyway that isn't so heavy.
author: Misti L.

description: It is a great place for take out.  If you eat in, it is quite cozy seating, but we can usually find a seat.  Food is fresh and tasty.  Restaurant is clean and not full of schmuzig.  A good alternative if you don't want the noise of Chevy's on Van Ness.  Staff is polite but not more.  Tables are clean.  Food is tasty and made to order.  You can watch them make it which is a plus.
author: Brian K.

description: excellent burrito and delicious salsa bar.  there's all sorts of fun shenanigans along the walls to peek at during your short wait which is nice. plus you got the option of hitting the bevmo across the street while you wait for all your alcohol needs
author: p c.

description: Great carne asada tacos and yummy Chicken Soup.  Love the salsa bar.  Everything seems so fresh!
author: Mick B.

description: I'll admit I'll probably come back here (cause common when your drunk and in the inner richmond how many options do you really have for a burrito?) but it's definately not somewhere I'd go outta my way for. Since gordos is their only other real competition out in this area let's compare the two....unlike gordos you don't watch them make your burrito, you simply order, and sit somewhere while your burrito is mysteriously assembled.  You get free chips and a salsa bar unlike gordos so I guess that's a plus but their burritos are smaller than gordos. Now onto the burrito...to say the best it was meh...too dry and I found it lacking any flavor, sorry pancho's I really wanted to like it but at least it did a good job of soaking up the alcohol. As for the price I'd say the value is better than gordos since you get free chips and salsa but for the same price I can get a wayyy better burrito in the mission but like I've mentioned before when your in the inner richmond how many other options do you really have ?
author: Mike A.

description: burritos are overpriced.  tacos were edible.  chips were stale.  they are the only place around inner richmond other than gordos and their food reflects that.
author: Paul H.
